Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, people, and spa”
Reviews.Author: Luv2relaxAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for most of a week, my first time visit. I travel frequently for work so I have stayed at many top hotels and resorts frequently (as a top Marriott / Starwood rewards member), but Rancho Bernardo Inn stands out in my mind as one of the top places I have had the pleasure to stay at. The lobby area is very cozy and quaint, and the rooms are simply stunning. There are plenty of marble counter tops and great wood shutters, all the better to enjoy the very cozy room or to open up and enjoy the stunning views of the golf course. I telecommute for work so I needed a high speed internet connection to attend remote webex meetings and phone calls. The internet connection is blazingly fast, far faster than my Marriott / Westin hotels I frequent. The staff is second to none. Everyone is so friendly and warm, and every where I walked (all over the property), I felt completely at home, with all of my needs and wants met. I also enjoyed the spa facilities, and I did not want to leave the facilities at the end of the day. The spa staff is fantastic, and they really made sure I had every need met. Not only did I enjoy the deep tissue massage, but I also loved the indoor and outdoor jacuzzi and pool areas as well. This was my first stay at RBI, and I really didn't know what to expect since it's so unique and different from my usual Marriott / Starwood stays. Simply put the staff, the hotel, the golf course and scenery, the food, the spa blew me away. I loved my stay so much I was actually very sad to leave and check out. I will definitely be back and would highly recommend this resort to any of my friends / family for a relaxing week / weekend, or for business meetings / work. If you are looking to stay here, take it from a top road-warrior, I love this property, and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal San Diego Getaway Destination”
Reviews.Author: MBWest6
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and the kids, all 4, had their own getaways one certain weekend. This never happens! My husband and I were looking for a getaway that we could get to easily on a Friday afternoon in the crazy commute that wouldn't take an eternity. I'd never been to the RBI and the website looked inviting. I phoned and got a fabulous spa package. The property was sold out when we arrived Friday and we were put in the Fountain Building on the 3rd floor above the A/C unit. During the day its fine when you close your door but at night you hear the roar of the fan circulating. This was over our A/C unit in the room which itself was very loud. It did stop working our Saturday night stay. Thankfully we were on the 3rd floor and able to sleep with our screen door open. And thankfully our bed was remarkably comfortable. The spa is lovely and I was given a wonderful massage by Sherry. The ladies working in the spa were gracious and welcoming. The steam/ jacuzzi area need a bit more care. There were washcloths to wipe your face, in a bowl, but with no ice. All the trash cans were overflowing. The spa pool was remarkably relaxing. There too the bar ladies were kind and expedient. I have to say overall the service at this property, from Paul in reservations, to Paul and Camille in the restaurant, really everywhere you went, the employees there seem to enjoy their work. While the property itself needs renovating, the grounds and employees make it a welcoming getaway for anyone who just needs a break.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful oasis, top notch service”
Reviews.Author: colomonica
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting. Great place for a meeting. It's a little ways off the beaten path so not sure I'd stay here on leisure, but you'd love it if you're just looking for a peaceful getaway or golf. It's not far to San Diego or beaches, just not right next door. Staff was outstanding, everyone knows your name & uses it, very well informed & friendly. Restaurants are very nice & a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Worn Out Property with Terrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: BabaBooeyStern
Reviews.Content: Reading this review, please keep in mind I'm rating this place relative to the cost and the image they try to portray on their website. A bit of modesty could help this place have a reality check. This place was probably nice when it opened, but it just looks tired and dated now. The website, advertising and photography portray a false image of this property as a high end luxury resort. For the price (even though I booked on points) and cost of their restaurant, this place just doesn't cut it. I stay in all types of places in and outside of the US for business so I'm really not that picky and try not to rate a place based on age, especially if certain items are updated and they keep the property clean. However I found that this place was just worn down. The landscaping is abundant, but it was a bit unkempt, and it really showed in the pool area. There was debris, leaves, dead bugs, etc. all in the pool and hot tub. Keep in mind they charge most guests a "resort fee" to use these services. For a place that is supposed to be high end, they are slacking on keeping the place tidy. I would also appreciate knowing there was a conference going on here during our stay, and furthermore being advised by the front desk. They told me about the Veranda Restaurant which we could eat at, yet they failed to tell me that a conference had a private party on the patio, so my wife and I had to eat inside when we were looking forward to relaxing on your patio by the fireplace which you so proudly display in photos on your website. Instead we come to California and have to eat dinner inside. We came here to stay in a nice place, not feel like outsiders that are relegated to certain parts of the hotel. Forewarning of amenities not available would be a good idea up front. Its the ethical thing to do. We also would have left for dinner. Good thing we only stayed one night. In regards to Veranda, the food was "OK". It wasn't special and thus again was overpriced. For dinner for 150 bucks I could go to an abundant number of restaurants that would make this place look like Chili's. Everything was just average. Breakfast was just blah, and again overpriced. Seriously not joking, Bob Evans breakfast is just as good.. This is a common theme unfortunately with places like this, they are so pretentious that they overcharge for everything under the guise of "luxury" and hope you won't notice just how average everything is. Go have breakfast at La Valencia in La Jolla if you want to see what an expensive breakfast should taste like. They even wanted 5 bucks for half of a grapefruit. Are you kidding me? So you are charging 10 dollars for a piece of fruit? Was this grown by magic fairies in never never land? Upon checkout the front desk was clueless on my preferred hotels points booking and tried to charge me for the stay as well as the resort fee which I was told were both covered upon my check-in. She then had to call about the rate, then tried to charge again for the resort fee, I then had to explain again that it was included per the check-in person. She took care of them but was completely zoned out and unapologetic about it. NOW THE WORST PART! Awful spring laden mattress that looks like its 10 years old and sleeps like a homeless shelter. My wife and I both woke up with sore backs. It bounces like a trampoline. The pillows were also terrible. Stiff and hard. Then, to make matters worse, you have some type of pad under the bottom sheet but its only queen sized?? so it doesn't fit, bunches up and you can feel it around your feet. Then you put a top sheet over the mattress that isn't even tucked in? Seriouisly the mattrress was exposed!! You don't even have a fitted sheet or a washable matress pad? Disgusting.. You can't have a quality resort and try to pretend its a relaxing place with beds this crappy. I just couldn't believe it. All we could do is laugh because it was so bad. And I travel about 33% of the year for business. I'm really not that picky normally, but this is supposed to be a high end place. I've stayed in Comfort Inn's with better beds than this. Hampton Inn's have more consistent bedding, perhaps your management team should stay in a Hampton to learn a bit about a decent bed, and Hampton isn't even close to luxury. At the least it would be an upgrade. Looking at other reviews, I'm not the first to mention it. For this alone I give this place 1 Star and would never go back. If you have to make a list of the top five things essential to a relaxing hotel, you have to include a nice bed. Guests should wake up feeling refreshed and revived, not with aching backs. My wife and I were even joking that they probably have bad beds to drive more business to the Spa for a massage! If the beds were decent I would have gave it three stars. Would never return or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry H
Reviews.Content: We went here for a meeting that lasted three days. I travel a lot and am spoiled by nice clean rooms. This place stunk of oldness, dust and mold. We would not wait to leave. The beds were very comfy. Too far away from everything! It is very pretty but we will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and golf course but felt the rooms were over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Jaxx-1
Reviews.Content: Just retuned from a business - vacation trip to the San Diego area. This resort had beautiful grounds and golf course. The staff were very friendly and professonal. The negatives would be...the location, it was 15 - 20 miles to downtown and the harbor. The rooms were nice but PRICY. Over all a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing or active -your choice”
Reviews.Author: kathleen51477
Reviews.Content: Always first class service all around from banquets to spa, all personnel smile and great guests and are willing to help at every level. The grounds are beautifully kept and offer tranquil gardens for relaxation. Eclectic and well thought out entertainment in the Veranda restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously!! WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: mary F
Reviews.Content: A total surprise. Our daughter is going through a difficult time and lives here. Dad and I are always entertained by her and it was our turn to surprise and take care of her. We live in Kansas and googled and found this wonderful off the beaten path place. I will recommend to all. Steve what a guy. The idea of a wine tour with limo. yay!!!!!! We had one of the best times of our lives. Forever a memory and one we will repeat in person. Thanks to all. STEVE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Inn was amazing in every way!”
Reviews.Author: konabev
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn was just spectacular! I could not have asked for a better place to bring some joy and happiness back into my life after the death of my husband. My daughters and I enjoyed every minute at the Veranda, cafe, pool and spa. The grounds are spectacular. The staff is 5 star! The value is truly amazing. I look forward to another wonderful "girls weekend" very soon.

Reviews.Title: “RBI is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Zach D
Reviews.Content: The spa is amazing... food is excellent and golf course is in the best shape i have ever seen! I highly recommend RBI for a nice relaxing weekend or a sensational golf getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Maria R
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a night's stay at RBI, dinner at the Veranada, and a massage at the spa for our 3rd anniversary. Everything was perfect. It like was heaven on earth. I had Rosey do my massage and she was incredible. It was by far the best massage I have ever received. She found every tight spot and knew just how to relieve it. I will be seeing her again next time! Even though we live only a few miles away, it's an incredible vacation destination and probably my favorite place in the world to visit (and I am very well travelled).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, quality and cleanliness of room...”
Reviews.Author: Mikecarew
Reviews.Content: Wonderful attitudes by all of the staff..the golf course was kept up very nicely...my girlfriend said the spa was relaxing and was everything she hoped it would be..overall a rad place to stay, eat, play golf, and get pampered! Definitely going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Looked forward to the return trip”
Reviews.Author: Jensmom79
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn and I knew this is where I wanted to stay on my return trip to San Diego. I thoroughly enjoyed the room which overlooked the grounds, which was just as nice as last year. The bed was comfortable and the view from balcony fantastic. The room including bath room was spotless. The newest treat was the addition of the Kuerig coffee maker. Great to have a good single cup of coffee in a couple of minutes. This time I also took advantage of the spa and steam room. Laura gave me the most terrific and relaxing massage. The spa was clean and roomy. As I sat in the waiting room in my comfy robe, I took advantage of the complimentary herbal tea and fresh water with lemon and cucumber. I will continue to stay at the RBI whenever I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: snucksman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the RB Inn several times and have always thoroughly enjoyed it! The rooms are comfy and staff is always attentive and friendly. If you get a chance to golf - go for it! My wife absolutely loves the spa, pools, etc. I actually just sneak down to a little hot tub near our room and it's always clean with fresh towels. This last visit, I noticed a little thing. The towels were neatly covered with plastic because of a chance of rain - even at this small, remote tub location. Walks around the property are most enjoyable and there's always an impressive amount of conference activity. The patios (with nice fireplaces) and the newly redesigned bar(s) are very enjoyable afternoon/evening venues - we were lucky to experience a great local band. Sunday brunch rocks and try the local Sculpin beer on tap! Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburghpausa
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo Inn is one of the most beautiful and relaxing places anyone could stay! I have stayed there many, many times. The rooms, spa, food and dining are incredible. My most favorite thing is sitting in front of the outdoor fireplaces with a glass of wine. Look for Vicki will at the Veranda. Her laugh us contagious!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here-you're wasting your money”
Reviews.Author: StrangeChicago
Reviews.Content: I travel to SD every year, this being my 6th. I have stayed at many "resorts" so I thought this one would be great. How wrong I was. 1. the beds are hard as rocks [and the sheets don't feel clean] 2. there was an air pump that kept going off in my bathroom all night 3. the decor is from the 70's, nothing is updated except the main lodge 4. there are no elevators-and all the rooms are located outside of the main check in area, expect to walk a lot up or downhill for everything AND expect to either a. pay a bellman to bring your bags to your room or b. drag it up or down several flights of stairs 5. expect to see dirty room service dishes all over the property. I witnessed random plates and half eaten food all weekend 6. I hope you like nature, because bullfrogs kept me up all night 7. the closet doors did not close, so the light in the closet went on and off all weekend. I had to put my bag in front of the door to keep the light off 8. the room had a musty smell and the carpet was grimy like it had not been cleaned in years. 9. I hope you like walking-there is no other way to get around the property. Up and down 45 degree angled hills The plus side: 1. the restaurant food was good 2. I got the best hot rock massage at the spa And THATS IT...

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home. . .”
Reviews.Author: billandlisa2
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite hotels! Rancho Bernardo makes us feel at home. . . the ambiance reflects a fine balance of comfort and elegance, set in a serene and natural surrounding. All the staff are extremely friendly and greet you as if you have always been living there, giving you a sense of belonging. We were particularly well taken care of by your Front Desk Supervisor, Kyle Mitchell, who patiently assisted us with last minute changes to our room reservations. Thank you, Mr. John Gates (General Manager) and all your staff for continuing to make our experience at the Rancho Bernardo the bestest ever! We will be back very soon. . ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf & Great Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: KritsPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This was my 25th year with a group of golfers that once again made their annual trek to Rancho Bernardo Inn for golf, good food and some relaxation. The golf course is both challenging and fun to play with the opportunity to play other area golf courses in their golf package.....Maderas for one. The food and service is well above average and they go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Any problems, just say the word. Can't recommend it high enough.

Reviews.Title: “another great trip”
Reviews.Author: kevin p
Reviews.Content: Last year 8 guys made the trip to RBI for 30th annual golf trip. It was great! this year we did it again. Lodging, service, food, golf course and the weather were excellent. Rooms are bright and comfortable, dining and drinking outside are relaxing, love the Starbucks each morning. Golf course was in great shape. Hard to beat the guys loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit”
Reviews.Author: Camdog11
Reviews.Content: Just spent the past nine days at RBI for the second straight year on golf trip with friends. Accomodations, restaurants, golf course and service could not be better. Everything was first class! Hope to be back again!

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 9 day golf trip to RBI. Incredible. We played the well manicured course 5 times, hit the spa, at way too much in the restaurant and enjoyed the service of the employees. We stayed here last year and will return next year. We were there March2-11. Thank you RBI

Reviews.Title: “A Great Night!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge K
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn! We're locals and went for a night out after our friends in the area told us about it. We had drinks at Veranda Fireside and Dinner at El Bizcocho. The service and food were excellent at both and we love the grounds! The Suite had an awesome outdoor fireplace too! A great night! - Jorge K.

Reviews.Title: “As close as you can get to a perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive the Staff is beyond exceptional . So friendly and accomodating. Veranda bar is beatiful with a giant fire pit. I met some great people both there for Business and vacations and the food is great. filet mignon, cooked to perfection and the Bartenders and wait staff are all great. , Shuffelboard table is really hard to get good at. I love the rooms and this time I got a Garden room looking out onto the fountain, the two pools are well appointed and very clean. Only thing missing was poolside food and drink service.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING TIME”
Reviews.Author: Peter Z
Reviews.Content: by far the best time of my life. the views are great, the serentity is beyond imagine. i could not have asked for a better time. everyone on site was extremely friendly, the golf was fantastic, the spa was to die for, and the food was 11 out of 10 stars amazing!!!!! will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “My March stay.”
Reviews.Author: 11Josephine
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and professional. From the desk clerk, restaurants, spas and of course the sales team.

Reviews.Title: “the rancho bernardo inn dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: stephanie v
Reviews.Content: i have been to the rancho bernardo inn numerous times..my sister married a year ago here also, and i have continued to have family and friends meet here when they are in town..the food is amzing and the people are so friendly..wonderful service and a beautiful view wherever you are located...it feels like paradise so even if you just have a few days to spend you wont leave without a huge smile on your face..i highly reccomend the rancho bernardo inn...also wanted to add that every server that i have had has been amazing, thank you, stephanie victor

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!!!! (and golf)”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: I went to RB Inn for my 50th birthday. I have to say it is one of the best places I have stayed and the food was FABULOUS - pricey, (El Bizcodho) but we got a good deal with the room and golf package. All of the staff was friendly and very helpful. They gave me a great 50th welcome gift, but I won't tell you, it will spoil the surprise. Nice touch with the personal note from the manager. Thank you Mr. Gates! My husband and I had a 2nd floor room overlooking the 10th hole and the jacuzzi was not far away. Unfortunately, we didn't get to utilize the spa, but I would recommend it. I hear it is great! When you call to make reservations, ask for Jean - she is WONDERFUL and will get you a great deal/package. Thanks RB Inn Staff for everything!!!!!! It will be a 50th I'll never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meetings!”
Reviews.Author: Ghofmann111
Reviews.Content: My company hosted 100 guest at this wonderful resort. From check in thru meetings, dinners and golf you could not ask for a friendlier, great place to get away. The rooms have been redone, are small but nice. The only downside is they did not redo the bathrooms. 20 year old tub and comode as well as old composit sink surrounds. Not bad enough to say don't come here, just a surprise because the rest of the resort is great. Definatly would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Golf outing”
Reviews.Author: russlnizzl
Reviews.Content: Took my wife for a one night stay as a JC Club member and just loved everything about the place. Great service, food, and grounds. Great golf course too! Highly recommend the Rancho Bernardo Inn to fellow vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “1st time visit at Rancho Bernardo to celebrate Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaA1227
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with the beauty and tranquility of the resort. The service was amazing. It is evident that there is excellent management and training in the area of carrying out excellent customer service. We appreciate how staff engaged in conversation, asked questions and quickly responded to any requests. I wish we had this service everywhere we visited. It truly made all the difference for us. We love the attention to detail. We were celebrating our Anniversary and upon arriving, we had a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries along with a personal note from the Manager. Nice personal touch! Also our server at the El Bizcocho wished us a Happy Anniversary (without any questions or prompting) and we were served a complimentary glass of champagne in honor of our celebration. The service was above and beyond and the resort was beautiful. Thank you to the management and staff for all the effort to make our stay truly enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, can't wait to go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy K
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego at the harbor area with my husband on business and we had a few extra days to spend time before heading back East... I searched for a resort and spa and found Rancho Bernardo Inn and boy am I glad!!!. This was a wonderful relaxing vacation. I went and had a couple of spa treatments and spent the rest of the day at the spa pool and ammenities. The next day my husband and I played golf and it was again a great experience. The entire staff was pleasant and helpful, wether it was at the pro shop, the spa, the front desk or the restaurants!! We had the opportunity the next morning to play golf again (early) and the Inn provided us with a late checkout time. I had no problem with the internet or anything. We had three lovely meals and drinks and I am hoping to talk my friends into going with us next time !!! Thanks Rancho Bernardo Inn...it was GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetBarbie71
Reviews.Content: JC Resorts obviously has a fantastic training program for their staff. Everyone I encountered was friendly, professional, helpful, and seemed genuinely interested in assisting me. The entire resort feels like a luxurious garden, the rooms are gorgeous, the food is magnificent. Great meeting space, beautiful spots for weddings, you can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandy F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, clean, relaxing, quiet hotel, I heartily recommend it as a luxurious, reasonably priced get away. The only slight hesitation I have is that internet service was spotty in the room I was in.

Reviews.Title: “I am sure I speak for all of us”
Reviews.Author: PowayPatricia
Reviews.Content: The occasion was a 60th birthday celebration. I started out needing two rooms, ended up with seven. Lindi in reservations managed to get all of us in one wing and Mandy at the desk was a big help in making sure every person that came was greeted and assured they had the right rooms reserved for them. The Woodside units are awesome. We had our own gathering patio complete with fireplace and outdoor jacuzzi. We are all locals or were at one time, having graduated from Poway High a long time ago and some of them have never stayed at the Inn before, but had friends that worked there just out of high school. Now I am sure they all will be returning, I know I will be. This is a most beautiful and peaceful place to stay, walk the grounds and enjoy our San Diego weather.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views and Great Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ReneGood
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the Inn, we were greeted by the valet parking attendants, with big welcoming smiles who were handsomely attired in vintage golfing duds. Our good mood had already been set by the friendly thoughtful assistance with our reservations by Lyndi. Upon check in, Mandy helped in her sweet, informative manner to guide us to the most beautiful and comfortable room (#629) on the ranch. The gorgeous grounds have quiet serene golf course views, spashing fountains, chirping birds and meandering paths that somehow give the illusion of solitude. We felt the ranch and staff were there simply to cater to us! While there are several jacuzzi hot tubs and 2 pools on the property for guests use, there is a $30 charge for the use of The Spa pool, which also has other amentities for an additional charge. I felt this $30 charge and parking fees to be excessive. All in all the time at the Rancho Bernardo Inn was perfectly delightful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Ron R
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful piece of property. The improvents they have done to the Veranda patio & bars are great! The spa is top notch and the setting for the spa pool are perfect. I will recomend this to my company for group events.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about staying here - Multiple thefts have occured”
Reviews.Author: Rebekah B
Reviews.Content: I attended a NSM in Jan, where we had over 100+ employees staying for four days, all meals included, with snack and beverage service. The food was nothing extraordinary, and the service was fair. My second day at the conference my BMW was stolen out of the parking lot sometime before 7:30 p.m. Valet and Security were less than helpful as was the Front Desk Manager. All they did was call the non-emergency police so I could make a report. They never offered to take me home (I'm a local resident) and when asked if I could use their car service (they have two Lincoln Town cars) they informed me they only drive within a 5 mile radius of the hotel and could not make an exception to take me to Carlsbad, when asked if they could pick up the tab for the taxi, they declined, and offered me a drink ticket for the bar. The front desk manager apologize and also informed me a few months back they had a flat screen TV stolen out of their room and a security guard assaulted. Word got out quickly that my vehicle was stolen and needless to say, the local employees were on edge and checking on their cars throughout the day, not a good way to spend your time at a National Sales Meeting. For the amount of money they charge, their customer service is terrible and their security isn't any better. All in all a very poor experience and my company will not be going back, nor will the employees.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fab!”
Reviews.Author: Gerardo P
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend my birthday at Rancho Bernardo Inn and this must have been the best decision of my life! From the time we arrived at the parking lot on Saturday until we checked out the following day, the staff at Rancho Bernardo Inn catered to our every whim. The food at El Bizcocho was exceptional and the service was not just professional but extremely friendly. This was our second visit but I know there will be a third in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: pat33020
Reviews.Content: our room in the 600 building was large and had a great view of the hills. The out door fire place looked nice We did not have time to use but will on the next trip. Golf was great (not my game ) but the course was in good shape. We ate at the Veranda and had a pleasant experience. Will go back .

Reviews.Title: “Great property for corporate event/meeting. Totally recommend!”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: I've been to several resorts for corporate meetings, but never have I worked with such exceptional staff. Everyone went out of their way to make me and our entire organization--all 150 + of us feel at home. There's a certain personalization that RB has. The fact that they're family owned and not part of a big conglomerate works to their advantage and to ours. If I needed something: DONE! They had it handled and did so with grace. Their Aragon ballroom is spectacular. The rooms surrounding the ballroom have those air walls that keep noise out and their doors to the ballroom are absolutely silent! The catering was absolutely fantastic and we all complained at the end of the week that we all probably put on 5-7 pounds. Looking forward to going back to RBI for another event in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, over priced, over rated!”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Overrated, overcharged, truly awful. My wife and I bought their new year package. I will not ever go back. Never. If I were you, I'd assume their best days are long since gone. I've been there before, and I have to say, it gets worse every time and this is really the last time. No more benefit of the doubt. Brunch - How do you say enough bad things about a breakfast that included NO fresh fruit (are you kidding), a poor collection of overdone and underdone buffet choices, including eggs Benedict that we could barely chisel through with our dull knives. I would not have paid $15.00 each for that breakfast, or I guess you called it brunch, and we were presented a bill showing us that had this not been included in our package, we would have been charged $59.00 each. Ridiculous! They did that so we would goose the tip for the wait staff - awful waitstaff - unqualified to wash your car waitstaff - you're better off at Denny's. Now let's talk about dinner. A truly awful experience. It would take me longer than I care to spend listing all the reasons it was one of the worst dining experiences I have had in many years but suffice it to say it was ONE HOUR between the soup and the main course. Yes, ONE HOUR. Sure, money was credited on the bill. Big deal. What was taken away and we can never get back was the experience. Instead of experiencing a nice, well paced meal at a place that bills itself as a top flight restaurant, we were ignored for ONE HOUR while the kitchen did who knows what. The floor manager, who passed himself off, by the way as a sommelier, (yeah, right - it's pouring real well, my customers are buying a lot of it - he didn't have the vaguest idea what he was talking about), said the kitchen had "stuff" happening. I had to go track the wait staff down after not seeing anyone in ONE HOUR. Oh, and same dull knives to cut our lamb. Utensils are too expensive to stock? Those of you who had read my other reviews know I don't usually just rant but this place is over-priced and WAY overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service is alive and well at the Rancho Bernardo Inn!”
Reviews.Author: NorskefromMN
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here with my wife in January after her work conference was over. I am always amazed at how good customer service is a thing of the past in most industries. Not so at this wonderful inn! Whenever we would ask a question of the staff the answer was always "yes". From the spa to the restaurants and everything in between this place caters to your every need. Our room was spotless, comfortable, and clean every day. We spent a day lounging in the spa and pool area which was wonderful. We both had wonderful massages. Nighttime dining at the restaurant was superb with a 4-course tasting menu that was delightful, not to mention an outstanding selection of wines. This place is old California at its finest. We would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Superfantastic19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary at the Rancho Bernardo Inn and it was simply amazing! From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of by the staff. The founds are beautiful, the rooms are very comfortable and we had an great view of the golf course. The spa was great- make sure to get an outdoor massage in one of the small cabanas...it was a very cool experience. You may want to dinner out on the patio by the fireplaces. Relaxing with a glass of wine by the finre is the only way to dine at teh RBI. Looking forward to getting back their soon!

Reviews.Title: “revisiting after more than twenty years”
Reviews.Author: jojoPwllheli
Reviews.Content: After more than 20 years since our last visit, we found this hotel has not lost any of it's star qualities. After travelling for two months , it was an ideal location to wind down before our return to the UK. Can't wait for our next visit. Wonderful friendly staff, super food and wonderful ambience

Reviews.Title: “Warm for the holidays”
Reviews.Author: Lanedomain
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for the holidays, and had a great stay at this inn. They had a ginormous gingerbread house in the lobby, which fascinated the kids. The Veranda restaurant was good, and a pretty room. Staff friendly and warm, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort feel with limited food options”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: This property is awesome. Friendly check in and personal escort to our room. Room's patio walked out to the golf course which was just too cool. Huge hd tv, spacious room, two chairs, and plenty of room for activities. Aveda bath products are always nice. This was one of the best rooms I have ever seen. Staying here 4 nights was way too much because of the limited food options. There is really only one bar that serves substandard cuisine and some I the restaurant menu. We came in expecting several distinguished dining options but it all was blah. We were forced to sculp out the surrounding area instead of doing the true "resort" thing by not leaving. For over $600 in breakfast lunch dinner for 2, we left feeling like the food was a ripoff and trust me it was all average. You know the feel when one chef cooks for several menus. Even room service served the same menu options! However, room service was a life saver as it rained all day Sunday. Food was delivered perfectly each time, props to their staff for this! How you deliver cold salads, hot food and appropriate condiments every time AND in the rain is astonishing.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kitty M
Reviews.Content: Had a completely relaxing time at this beautiful resort. We plan on going back and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good things do come at an afforable price”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased our thru the living social special. I felt that it was worth every penny. The grounds were gorgeous, the views were great and the food was very amazing. I would highly recommend for a nice romantic great away. I paired this deal with a wine tasting at a local winery for a perfect weekend. I would defiantly return to Ranch Bernardo Inn again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment on several levels.”
Reviews.Author: JPortia
Reviews.Content: From the website, this looked like a beautiful place to stay. It's a great reminder for me that marketing isn't about accuracy--it's about sales. The reservationist got our date wrong then didn't return my call after multiple attempts to correct the issue. I should have backed out then, but I called the front desk instead to resolve it. The front desk was fantastic every time I called them before and during the stay, however. We arrived after a long day at the zoo with my young son. Valet/bell asked if we'd like assistance, we said yes (twice), but when they saw our room location, they basically insisted we park ourselves. That's fine except we had to haul our bags, with our tired 5 year old through a big parking lot and up a few flights of stairs and all the way around the building. After a long day, it would have been nice to have someone help with our bags, especially since we said we'd like help. Room service was great. Went above and beyond to make suggestions on dinner and gave us perfect directions--elsewhere. Once we got to the hotel, we weren't feeling so confident about having dinner at the hotel, so we went out. The room was a miserable disappointment. Great view, but there were several issues that stopped us from enjoying our stay. The decor was fine, not horrible, not great. It was dated like the exterior of the hotel. The bathroom was spacious and attractive though. It was bright with a nice soaking tub, separate shower with a rain shower head. White subway tile and classic beige marble. Not over the top, but definitely the nicest part of the suite, actually. That's where the nice ended. The construction is either so old that the floors shake, or it's always been very, very, poor. You couldn't tip toe across the room without the floor shaking severely, and we are not big people. I had to call the front desk to make sure there was no one below us because I was worried we were bothering the neighbors. It was ridiculous. Made it difficult to relax because I felt like we had to just sit quietly on the bed and not move around. The next misery was that I found (without looking) many long brown hairs around the suite--inside the sheets, in the bathtub, on the pillow etc. Really gross. It was probably from the housekeeping staff and not the previous guests, but still so not okay to find other people's hair everywhere you are going to sleep. Then there was an area in the grout next to the mini fridge that was sticky, stained, and smelled suspiciously like vomit--while standing nearby. Sorry to be rude, but it was foul. I threw down a towel so we didn't have to walk on the tile. So, at this point, we just wanted to go to sleep so we could get up and leave in the morning. Well, a good night's sleep wasn't in the cards. The sheets and pillows were the absolute worst quality I may have ever felt. Not kidding. That includes the hospital stay when my son was born. They were stiff, scratchy and so cheap. I've never been to prison, but I'm just imagining the sheets... The bed started with horrible mattress, a flat sheet, then a "comforter" and another flat sheet. Since the first sheet wasn't fitted, we were literally sleeping on the bare mattress by the morning. If you turn over at all while sleeping, the sheet just moves too and ends up slipping out from under you. Again, so gross. Can't even imagine what my family was sleeping on all night. Seriously, the worst night's sleep EVER in a hotel. After that, all I wanted to do was have each of us take a hot shower with lots of soap. Wished we had brought flip flops for the shower, but the water was hot, the pressure was great, and the aveda products were nice. Of course, then we had to get out of the shower and dry off with towels that the YMCA wouldn't supply for free. I think I am traditionally very fair with reviews and almost forgiving at times. However, the issues we had here, some of them so easy to fix, were just unacceptable for any hotel. Seriously, actually CLEAN the rooms and then spend some money on new bedding and towels. The floor shaking issue, would be harder to fix, but they should be ashamed of the other issues. If you stay here, good luck. Wish I had read more honest reviews before booking.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort - Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: overflo40
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked this hotel through a Living Social package to enjoy a quick getaway from Los Angeles to celebrate our anniversary. It was our first visit to this hotel, and also our first time using such a discounted package. Quite frankly, we were ready for the other shoe to drop at any moment - assuming the deal sounded too good to be true. Boy, were we wrong. Without any hesitation, the hotel staff honored everything we were granted in our package - and more. A special thanks for the complimentary delivery of champagne and strawberries by the hotel manager - proof positive the folks at the Rancho Bernardo Inn know how to pay attention to the small details. And the food? Top notch. We dined at both restaurants, and I can honestly say the meal at El Bizcocho was one of the best meals I've ever had - the chef/waiter even allowed substitutions to accommodate our requests. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel - first class food, service, rooms, and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “"Pleasantly surprised with our stay...excellent service"”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Rancho Bernardo Inn and all the services it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, Views, and Golf Course. Room Quality Fair”
Reviews.Author: gsmyles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a staycation over the Halloween holiday with our children. The rates were discounted which made it affordable and the Halloween activities were fun, although you had to pay for everything to eat, etc. which felt like we were nickeled and dimed. I eat at the Veranda regularly and really love the views, the property, and the amenities such as the pool and spa. I was surprised though at the room quality. I have stayed in true Family style hotels such as Homewood Suites/Towneplace/Hyatt Place that have done a better job decking out rooms and modernizing them. As I think the Inn is more elite and would be classified as a high end resort, don't get your hopes up if you are in a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hacienda-style resort northeast of San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: AUNTIEGORGEOUS
Reviews.Content: We were attending a wedding reception at the Orfila Winery in Escondido and wanted to spend the night at a hotel close to the winery. We ended up at the Rancho Bernardo Inn by chance through an amazing Hotwire deal. The resort is located in the middle of a residential neighborhood about 10 miles northeast of San Diego. If you are looking for a relaxing golf/spa/wine tasting weekend away Rancho Bernardo Inn is an awesome choice. If you want to spend lots of time in downtown San Diego, this is not the place for you because of the location of the resort. When you walk through the front doors of the resort, you feel as if you've entered a warm, private hacienda. Although an older property, the rooms have been beautifully refurbished and the grounds meticulously maintained. Unfortunately we were only there overnight and did not get to take advantage of the resort amenities, however made sure to treat ourselves to breakfast because we were told by a friend that the food there was amazing. We ended up having brunch at Veranda and it did not disappoint! We enjoyed our short stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday & Thanksgiving Holiday at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: lkw3002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled from Virginia to spend time with her family here in San Diego. I cannot recall a better resort experience than the one I had this past week. Our request to change rooms (too close to an ice machine noise) was instantly processed to a top floor room with a fantastic golf course view (room 740). The staff from valet to management was gracious and attentive. Leslie, our Concierge, personally showed us the resort layout and suggested many helpful tips. To my surprise, she even had a Birthday treat delivered to our room. The facilities were clean and well cared for: The hot tubs Hot and Clean with fresh towels near by. The golf course is challenging and a delight to play. The golf staff was courteous and professional. I found the food to be excellent along with the serving staff. My wife, a diabetic, had every special request easily fulfilled. We attended the Manager's welcoming cocktail reception: An hour long experience of open bar, good food, and good music. I just reviewed the final bill and for the first time was actually able to understand (clearly documented) the charges incurred. I can't say the same for a number of other establishments. From check-in to check-out, an overall delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “USC ucla game”
Reviews.Author: y2k1
Reviews.Content: We have 30 people here wanting to watch game and eat . No guarantee to watch game says staff ok will eat and drink elsewhere. Not smart service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to ge back to this incredible property. Everything from start to finish was incredible there. From making my reservation, checking in, my room, the spa, both restaurants, the cafe, the grounds the staff and checkout! I have not one complaint except that my say was too short. Can't get back soon enough...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Local Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CASUNLOVER_7
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Rancho Bernardo Inn this past Sunday night for my husbands birthday. My brother in law had booked us a couples massage at the spa and I decided, why not stay the night. I booked it last minute and fortunately they had a room available. I booked an regular room but upon arrival was upgraded to a room overlooking the golf course. We were on the top floor of the 700 building which not only afforded us a beautiful view of the golf course but were able to enjoy the vaulted ceilings in our room. It was so rustic but with modern amenities, such as a large flat panel TV and a beautiful king size bed that was lite from the bottom to give it a very warm glow. The bathroom was stunning with a huge soaking tub and separate shower enclosure. I also loved the Aveda hair and skin products! That's definitely a nice touch! We checked in our room with only a few minutes to spare before we had to be at the spa for our massage and when we returned the staff had left a plate of cheese and a bottle of wine for my husbands birthday! Compliments of the hotel! Now that is a first class resort!! The spa is amazing! I have been there before for a massage and really enjoy sitting by the pool after my massage if it's a nice day. My husband did not golf this time but has golfed at the RBI in the past and he says it's one of his favorite courses! This is an amazing resort with the best customer service I have ever had! We are so lucky to only live about 20 minutes from this wonderful place! We will definitely be back! Thank you RBI for making my husband's birthday one to remember!! You guys are the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been a better experience...”
Reviews.Author: CMG1984
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were immaculate and the staff were friendly. The food at the Veranda (their casual dining restaurant) was but pretty good - love their pizza. Based on all of these, I would have given my experience 4 stars; however, one item really soured my experience. I called the front desk on Thursday morning - very early - asking if they could schedule a couple of spa services for me for the next day. I was informed that I would have to leave a voicemail for the spa as they are the only ones who have access to the appointment book. That made sense - so, I left the spa a voice mail. I never heard from them all day and upon returning to the hotel, later that evening, inquired again. I was informed the spa was closed but that the front desk would send them an email to contact me first thing Friday morning. I was on conference calls until about 11am on Friday morning and never heard from the spa. I left a voice mail with the manager of guest services informing her that the spa lost out on approximately $400 as no one had gotten back to me. I specifically stated I wasn't looking for anything free, but just wanted to make the Inn aware of the matter. I left the resort to go and enjoy the day in La Jolla. Around 2pm, I received a call from the spa asking me if I wanted to book my services for Saturday. I told them that I had left that voice mail the prior day and that I had wished for spa services on Friday. The response I get is "oh, I'm sorry, we can book you now". I retorted no thanks since I'm in La Jolla - 25 minutes away. BTW, I never heard back from the guest services manager either, which I do believe is poor customer service. I'm still giving this experience three stars because, other than the spa mistake and lack of responsiveness, everything else was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: I recently took a business trip to San Diego this past week and stayed at Rancho Bernardo Inn. What a great resort! My experience there was nothing short of first class. Customer service was awesome, rooms where immaculate, dinning was great, and the beds, oh the beds, so comfortable. And for those who can sneak out on the golf course for a round of golf will be amazed at the attention to detail and its sheer beauty. I can personally say that I am a RBI customer for life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Truly a relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: Sacooch
Reviews.Content: We visited as part of a 25th wedding anniversary trip that started with the wild of Las Vegas, then Palm Springs with friends and wound down with a relaxing visit to the resort for golf and spa. Everything exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great beer tasting excursion!”
Reviews.Author: MrDoof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Rancho Bernardo Inn during a recent visit to San Diego. We just stayed one night and booked a golf course view room. Room was nicely appointed and recently updated. Bed was very comfortable. We were on the first floor of a three story building, so the golf course view was pretty limited. Front desk and bell staff were friendly and helpful. You get charged a $19 resort fee that covers internet, a newspaper, self park, or valet park - and a few other items I can't remember. The real bargain of the stay was booking their microbrewery tour. For an extra $100, we were picked up in a stretch limo and driven to three separate microbreweries in the north county. First stop was Iron Fist Brewing in Vista. Next stop was Lost Abbey Brewery in San Marcos. Last stop was Stone Brewing Company in Escondido. Included with the limo transportation was a voucher for tastings at each of the breweries and a gourmet snack basket to bring along. It was 3+ hours of a great time. Each brewery was awesome and unique and proud to tell you all about their product. My wife, who really prefers wine over beer, said it was one of the best foodie excursion she has ever been on. I can't sing high enough praises about what an awesome vening it was.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Alexander S
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I recently attended a "Beer Vs. Wine" dinner at Rancho Bernardo Inn's El Bizcocho restaurant and decided to show up in the early afternoon and check out the grounds of this "legendary inn", needless to say this place was pure magic! Friendly staff like no other place. We are used to staying at 5 star resorts, Ritz, Montage ect... yet Rancho Bernardo Inn has the elusive quality of authenticity that so many places lack. Our dinner was in a word Incredible, hosted by a number of truly entertaining guests (wine and beer people) not to mention the star of the night the Chef who had us rolling on the floor laughing, and stunned by the quality of the food! We will most certainly recommend this place to all of our discerning L.A. friends!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Darkdivine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. First night we bought the dinner package and the for second night the unlimited golf package. RBI turned out to be a great value!!! We did not leave the property our entire stay. The food was amazing! The service was exceptional. Staff members are helpful and very friendly. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we taken care of. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The rooms are spacious and relaxing. It was a perfect weekend. We didn't want to leave. :)

Reviews.Title: “So Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jill H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me for my birthday and it was one of the most romantic nights. The room was probably the nicest I've ever stay in. We had a delicious dinner out on the patio at the Veranda surrounded by fire places and romantic lit lanterns. The next day we played tennis, had a couples massage in the outdoor cabana and finished the day poolside for lunch. The property is absolutely peaceful and breathtaking. The grounds are kept so nice and staff is extremely friendly. I've been to RBI quite a few times, but never stayed the night and my expectations were exceeded. I will definitely stay here again for a weekend getaway and highly recommend it for out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and experience.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne S
Reviews.Content: The staff, facilities, as well as the golf course make staying at the resort a special place where you can park your car and not have to leave for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful, private getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a girl's getaway during a recent weekend and had such an amazing time! The rooms were spacious and beautiful and the staff were wonderfully helpful. We did different kinds of spa treatments and lounged by the beautiful spa pool. I loved all the private courtyard areas within the hotel so much I think I will recommend this place for anyone I know planning a wedding. I live in San Diego but I cannot wait to go back to the Rancho Bernardo Inn for a mini vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: 007world
Reviews.Content: It has big sprawling grounds and a fun golf course. Friendly staff. Our room had a nice standup shower, seperate tub, comfy king bed and great views of the golf course.The only downside to it is an older designed property and if someone was in a wheelchair it may be difficult to get around. My only complaint is that the AC is room 729 was also very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Spa AHHHH AHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: Suzie S
Reviews.Content: Hello, I was recently fortunate to visit the Inn at Rancho Bernardo for the day. The boys played golf and the girls went to the spa. The boys had a lot of golf things which were raving and good about the course, it's level of maintenance and it's (other golf stuff.) But oh...the spa. From the moment we got there, we were treated so well and with warmth, we had lunch by the pool in an awesome cabana and then the spa treatments.....I had a facial from one of the leads (I am bad with names) but she was AMAZING! The ceiling is very high in the treatment room and it was beautiful to look up and out! My skin felt like butter after the facial and it was my birthday so they gave me a lovely little gift (just like the whole day was...a gift) I will go back over and over, I live close so it's the PERFECT place for me to forget all my worries and enjoy all the wonder of Rancho Bernardo. It was an amazing day and I thank the spa staff for being so so good at what they do!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat that is a Treat”
Reviews.Author: Crosby1
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the level of service and the people who operate this lovely mid-century revitalized resort complex that is close to San Diego but yet far enough away to make you feel like you are in the countryside. The fellow who is the General Manager obviously has done a good job of hiring young, helpful staff noticeable from the minute you arrive. Not just staff trying to be pleasant but really nice folks who made our stay memorable and who really cared about us - not just their paycheque. Food is excellent in both the more casual Terrace Restaurant which overlooks the golf course to the formal dining room which we heard was going through a make-over shortly...but as long as the quality of the food from Chef Nic remains the same - with an emphasis on locally grown items - we can see why locals and visitors alike flock to this place for special events, meetings and a weekend getaway. Ask for a room overlooking the golf course...quiet and close to the main building with a lovely bar area and again, outstanding service. The Spa is lovely, the golf course is a bit of an older style, resort course but playable for all levels which makes it fun because you are not constantly being punished for a bad shot. If you want a real challenge go 7-minutes up the road to Maderas Golf Course where 'target golf' abounds but green fees are pricey. Rancho Bernardo Inn is truly a place to relax and we spent four lovely nights at the place. If you want nightlife close by then this is not the place to book, go to downtown San Diego...but if you want a great guest experience, good value for your dollar spent, comfortable surroundings and a chance to leave your car in the parking lot and just unwind, then try this resort complex and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rancho Bernardo Inn - Beautiful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl P
Reviews.Content: I wish I could have stayed longer! The Rancho Bernardo Inn is a quite beautiful, quiet, and romantic place to stay. The rooms are large. You can sit back and relax with a glass of wine on the balcony and listen to the birds sing. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The many nice fountains make relaxation easy. Didn't have an opportunity to take a dip in the pool, but the area was certainly beautiful. The staff couldn't have been nicer. You will be treated like royalty! Located just a couple of miles from the Bernardo Winery where you will find the Cafe Merlot. And, oh my goodness, the food and wine are excellent! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Double Billed, Beware”
Reviews.Author: joyofjoys
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews where this hotel double charged or wrongly charged their guests, and the guests had a terrible time getting the incorrect charges reversed. I ignored them due to the seeming abundance of good reviews. Wow, am I ever sorry. This place is a nightmare. Suddenly nobody knows anything (I don't have access to that, my supervisor is gone today, blah blah blah) and can't even confirm exactly what they billed to my credit card, let alone why. I show them my credit card statement and even then, they say they don't see where they billed for the charges that are clearly listed on the statement. Its like falling down the rabbit hole; zero accountability. They are incapable of doing ANYTHING but charging credit cards and then pretending like they didn't do it. Frankly, its unbelievable. Which is why I ignored the previous reviewers who had the same problem. Well, believe it. I travel at least 40% of the year and have *never* been subjected to the degrading run-around these con artists have going. There are tons of places to stay in San Diego, choose somewhere else if you value your sanity and/or expect an ethical hotel management system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Skip A
Reviews.Content: We visited the Rancho Bernardo Inn with another couple who had stayed there before. The husbands played golf on a beautifully maintained golf course and the wives had a great relaxing spa day. After golf, we joined our wives at the spa pool where they were enjoying their time in one of the poolside cabanas. The pool area was clean and well maintained. The rooms were clean and actually had plenty of wall outlets to plug in all of our chargers for cell phones, laptops, etc. We had a nice view of the golf course. The staff was very pleasant and all the staff that I saw engaged me with a smile and "hello sir". The hotel is spread out like a campus setting and it is very well maintained. There are alot of garden type settings and great places to take a walk. There are some vineyards close by and it is about a 30 minute drive into downtown San Diego depending on time of day. I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: iliketropical
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute weekend getaway and stayed one night at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. Overall we had a great stay. The spa is definitely the highlight of the property and we had booked services for noon. My expectation was that the hotel would hold onto our bags for us until check-in. Instead the front desk didn't even say a word and sent us to our room at 10:30 a.m. The property itself is well maintained and can best be described as a garden setting. With that said, the architecture is late 1970s / early 1980s Spanish, which just makes the feel of the hotel stuck in this period. This place can do everything right, but the design just didn't age well and that's something that can never be changed. The rooms are comfortable and recently upgraded. The beds were firm with nice linens, the television was high def, ours had a patio overlooking a courtyard. The first floor rooms have private patios, but abut common areas and completely lack privacy. As has been mentioned before, the bathrooms seem dated, although they did look newer. Perhaps it was use of inexpensive and generic tile. The spa was great, but a tad pricey for services. Spa guests have access to the spa pool, which is a lot nicer than the hotel's "regular" pools. The food was average hotel food and reasonably priced. Drinks were a downright bargain with $4.00 beers across the property. Free ice tea is also available near the treatment rooms. My one negative comment about the spa is there were three bachelorette parties booked in the pool cabanas. This is fine, but maybe it shouldn't be sold as the spa pool. Really it's just the one remotely hip area the property has to offer and it is borderline day club on a Saturday. All they need is a DJ. Aside from the spa bar, there is also a series of bars in an area called the Viranda. These could just as easily be billed as one bar, not three. The outside area around the fire pit (billed as the Fireside Lounge) was a nice was to spend the early evening. There is also a bar immediately inside with a contemporary decor, and finally a separate area adjacent billed as the Sports Bar. Apparently this is slang used by staff to indicate it's the only place with a TV. The formal restaurant is nice, if not a bit dated and stuffy. Collared shirts are mandatory. I wore a suit and tie and felt comfortable. There is also a separate bar area for use while waiting for your table. The bartender, Tom, was great and had worked for the hotel forever. He was happy to check on our table for us and had just the right balance of conversation without being intrusive. The waiter was great as well, recognizing a long delay in the meal and bringing a complimentary item to address the problem without us even bringing it to his attention. On Sunday morning there are two separate brunches, and we had breakfast in the Viranda area before heading out. The selection of items was good, but again, it was the service that was standout. We did not leave the property once, which is exactly what we were looking for. This might not be for everyone though, and it's really quite a drive to central part of San Diego. The location is not practical if your goal is being out and about and just sleeping at the hotel. Also, there is absolutely nothing of interest in the immediate area. Finally, it's likely there are going to be multiple functions at the property which could affect your enjoyment. The Saturday we stayed, there were the 3 bachelorette parties, at least 2 weddings, and some type of couples workshop. We didn't have any problems, but I can easily see restaurants or pool areas being unexpectedly closed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Suryonhan
Reviews.Content: We loved Rancho Bernardo Inn. It is tucked away in the neighborhoods of Rancho Bernardo. The food was impeccable, El Bozocho was delicious! The rooms were always clean and the bed was comfortable. The property smells like lavendar and rosemary. Overall I would stay again. BTW, we got married here and it is a fantastic venue!!

Reviews.Title: “Setting lovely, staff amazing”
Reviews.Author: DrNanDann
Reviews.Content: Without reservation I highly recommend the Rancho Bernado Inn. The setting is beautiful, the inn lovely and comfortable, and the staff definitely goes the extra mile. For example, in the midst of a widespread power outage in southern CA, the staff quickly pulled together an outdoor grill night so guests would not go hungry. In addition, when a restaurant, where we were going to have a dinner for 60 guests cancelled at the last minute due to water safety concerns, the RBI was able to accommodate our dinner guests with a fabulous buffet, all with only 3 hours notice. I was amazed by their skill, eagerness to please, and general hospitality. We definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooking the small things brings it down from 5 to 4 star....”
Reviews.Author: RZPhyxit
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed over the Labor Day Weekend. We booked one night with the spa treatment inclusive (their website) and one night using a Group Golfer certificate for unlimited golf with the room rate. POSITIVES: 1)The unlimited golf was for both the day of check and check out! We fit in 3 rounds: 2 on the check in day, 1 on the check out day. Most resorts only offer 1 day of unlimited golf to each paid day of stay. 2)Friday night was a "Managers reception" with complimentary appetizers (good quality) and drinks (generous pours) It was family and kids oriented with a section of fun kids appetizers and centered around the pool. 3)The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. 4) The Veranda area is beautiful, overlooking the golf course and spectacular fountain. The lit firepit and fireplace is nice and the dinner / breakfast buffets were with wonderful choices and reasonable for the price. NEGATIVES/SUGGESTIONS: 1) The mens sauna was broken 2 days that we know of. The male masseuse was the only attendant to notify that it needed service. Of the 3 mens showers, only 1 had all 3 items: Shampoo, conditioner and shower gel available. The rest were in need refilling. 2) For both the mens or womens spa: There we NO iced towels (no significant cost) around the steam or jacuzzi areas. There were no disposable razors for clean-up/hygiene. 3) Our woodside room (#625) had a central fireplace and jacuzzi area. Although fresh wood was placed in the fireplace, it was never lit! Lighting it would draw people to gather and make it more inviting to sit after being in the jacuzzi. 3) Specific to the Golf course: We were not informed of the punched greens prior to scheduling tee times. This, combined with the rest of the 1st and poor 2nd cuts caused us to fee the course was not in good shape even though it is advertised to be the only S. Diego course to host both a PGA and LPGA tour event. On top of that, everyone who made tee times on Sat. Sept 3rd were not recorded correctly in the "computer", off by as much as 45 - 60 minutes. We also say 5somes and even a party of 6 (probably from the 7 wedding groups pre-golf event) on the course. Needless to say, starting an hour after a scheduled tee time and then being held up on every hole (6 hr. round) made it difficult to enjoy the course. We had just spent the Fourth of July at the Aviara in Carlsbad for a golf weekend. It was like golfing in a botanical garden! Perhaps this was still in our minds as a comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet at Rancho Bernardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sally H
Reviews.Content: From the friendly staff to the little niches and alcoves filled with antique furniture, this Inn is truly exquisite. At night there are lanterns lit and you feel like you are in a large private estate when you walk around. There were even little bunnies feeding on the lawn at sunset. The rooms are ultra private! I heard no sound form anyone both times I stayed there. The rooms have a huge balcony or patio. Huge tub and the bathroom is great! Aveda products. The grounds have wishing wells, fountains, outdoor scu;ptures and are very pleasing! The staff is wonderful!!!! Enjoyed myself very much!

Reviews.Title: “A romantic getaway in a romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a one night stay getaway and enjoyed ourselves so much we extended the weekend to two. Very spacious, nicely decorated rooms with a beautiful view of the sunset and the golfcourse. I had a spa day in one of the casitas, which was like being on a tropical island. My husband played golf and had one of the best days of golf ever! The staff and the property were five star. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 22maryann22
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting with a gorgeous golf course, spa and the food is incredible. The adult pool could be updated, but was still a nice place to lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful property! Great Service and Truly enjoyed our time here”
Reviews.Author: beachdude90
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are beautiful as well as the lobby, cafe's, restaurants, spa pool! The rooms are nice but the bathroom and hallways are outdated. The service makes you truly enjoy your stay. Even though they were extremely busy they still gave us a ride to and back from a wedding we attended at the Madera's Golf Club. Breakfast outside at the Veranda was the highlight of our mornings! The setting is truly beautiful! Also, the lady at the concierge desk was a great help! Thanks for the great stay! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “ALL EGO & NO SUBSTANCE”
Reviews.Author: Amandasr73
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently @ this acclaimed highly rated hotel. Much to my shagrin, I left feeling abused, taken advantage of & lied to. While the property itself is quite elegant of lush trees, golf course, spa & pools, im thinking those stars should be given to the workers who upkeep the property. The front desk staff, to which a first impression is made, are full of ego and dishonest. They act as if everyone staying with them is rich and if you are not, you should not be staying there. They take great liberties with your credit or debit card not fully disclosing what is actually being preauthorized from your account and when confronted after you were originally told nothing was being done with the card, they act as if something was wrong with you! Quite honestly the worst experience @ a hotel. There staff need to be trained on courtesy, compassion, kindness, and HONESTY. On to the room... the beds were hard, pillows stiff and crunchy, and the construction is OLD and not well kept. There is a constant sound of pipes in movement and adjustment, leaks in the room & bathroom, and old matted rugs. I had a better experience at a Crowne Plaza in Irvine, and much nicer staffer there. Overall, my experience @ Rancho Bernardo Inn was sadly dissapointing. They need to get with the program and realize they are dealing with people and not just a number.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Staycations EVER.”
Reviews.Author: cfcreative
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a quick weekend trip to RB Inn and we all had one of the best experiences... there's so much to do there for the whole family. Lots of activities for both young kids AND teens (Kids Rule, Parents Drool promotion) where kids get wrist bands for unlimited food and activities. We even got a little adult time to ourselves since the kids always had something to do. Rooms were spacious and very clean. We spend most of the time at the Santiago pool and the staff (Joe and Alexanderia) took great care of all of us. Meals at Veranda Restaurant was very reasonable and the service was supreme. Check out the floors if you ever visit... very cool decor. We hope to visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spa weekend, MARVELOUS!”
Reviews.Author: zhairdzinr
Reviews.Content: Fantastic spa!!!!!! Beautiful! Love the cabana's and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort Style.....AHHHHHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: nansee25
Reviews.Content: Top notch, everything was great and if a little hiccup came along they were right there to make it perfect.......Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Vacation at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: J V V
Reviews.Content: What a serene place to vacation ! We were spoiled by the room amenities, the spa, two restaurants, three pools, the filtered sunlit tree covered grounds, fountains galore and the green wide open spaces – no reason to leave ! The staff offered assistance at every opportunity, A+ for hospitality. We just spent a whole week at the Inn mid-August – batteries are recharged !

Reviews.Title: “This resort used to be my favorite”
Reviews.Author: 365daysofsun
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying this resort used to be among my favorites. And the many things it has going for it are beautiful grounds, a lovely spa, and a nice golf course. Unfortunately, their customer service has some major problems, which I will not go into since I have addressed them with the property directly. But the main problem, I think, is that this "Inn" has decided they now want to be a large event venue and in doing so, have lost all their focus on their quality of guest service. It has the potential to be a really special, romantic place for a getaway, but our last visit was a bit of a nightmare. Sad, because as I said, if they really aspired to it, they could do so much better. I hope the resort management will get back to basics and remember that excellent guest service is what will make or break this property.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING :)”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Bing
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a wonderful weekend getaway. We had such a wonderful time here we did not want to leave. The pools and grounds are well kept. It has one of the best golf courses I have EVER played on. The staff at the hotel is wonderful. They are great with attention to detail and very friendly. I did not see one of them without a smile on their face. It shows that they are all happy to be working there. We will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family Vacation! The Veranda and pool events were an unexpected bonus.”
Reviews.Author: EVTRAVEL32737
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Welcoming staff - our family received VIP treatment. The Veranda and pool events were an unexpected bonus! Beautiful venues in and around the Inn’s property. Our room was decadent including the view from the patio of the spacious golf greens and mountains. Discretely situated in the quiet neighborhood of Rancho Bernardo, the Inn is conveniently located within a short drive of San Diego's famous Wild Animal Park and orange-cliffed Torrey Pines State Beach - which are must sees. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “We loved it will be back in 2012”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, quiet and the golf was excellent

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Escape”
Reviews.Author: blackgold85
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was amazing. In the evening we would watch the sunset over the golf course from our room. The staff here arealso extremely helpful. They gave of excellent recommendations. The best part is how close you are to everything but still able to get away from the crowds in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with some character. Good amenities, nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: SDGirl79
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great character. The grounds are very nice and the rooms are a decent size. Our room overlooked pine trees and seemed like we were in the middle of a forest. The golf course is nice although they could use a marshall out on the course. Play was pretty slow. El Bizcocho restaurant is pricey, but the service and food were worth it. We got a good deal ($99/night) but the extra fees added up. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Resort and can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Brad F
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at Rancho Bernardo Inn and had the perfect experience. Where to start, the rooms are very nice and the housekeeping staff comes around twice a day. The rooms come with a separate bath and shower. My girlfriend really enjoyed the salts for the bath. We were in building 7 with views of the 10 tee and 18th green. We had great sunset views. There is also a fountain along the 18th hole which they add lights to night. A very nice touch. The food at Veranda was wonderful. Top notch service, good wine list and be sure to get a table on the patio. The golf course was in great shape and a lot more challenging than I expected. I am a 10 handicap and I played well above it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Classy”
Reviews.Author: Heartflight
Reviews.Content: The staff is warm and friendly and always helpful. Nice grounds as it is a beautiful golf resort also. The rooms are great. I stayed in room 169 and it was a very clean nice large double bed room with huge patio overlooking pool.Was very nice and quiet when I was there. Nice Aveda products used in bath area. spacious baths also. Frig- coffee maker in room and nice robes to wear in evenings. Large flat screen TV lots of great channels! Veranda patio very nice to enjoy a breakfast etc. View of golf course . Mellow atmosphere. Highly reccomend if you play golf........Nice vacation spot also. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Golf Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Murph C
Reviews.Content: Just thinking about last sptings 30th annual golf trip with my buddies which was the best ever! The location wad the Rancho Bernardo Inn in San Diego, CA. What a beautifull spot! Great rooms ,wonderful dining and a super golf course!! Cimbine that with a super friendly and attentive staff and you have all the makings of a great week!! Loved it so much can not wait to take my wife to enjoy!! Highly recommend the Rancho Bernardo Inn 111

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
