Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rancho Bernardo Inn last March. We had a beauiful view of the 10th fairway from the well appointed room. I used the health club daily, golfed at the golf course every other day, and at 2 of the restaurants. We swam a the pool and used the jacuzzi. In fact we hardly left. We are going back again next year for a week. Wouldn't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Camdog11
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Dan Diego and had great experience while staying at Rancho Bernardo Inn. Spent 8 days with buddies playing golf at the resort and surrounding area. Was treated first class at all times and all aspects ( golf, food, facilities, personnel etc.. ) of the resort were first class. Would recommend to anyone to stay at the resort. We are planning a return trip in March 2012 and hopefully adding an additional day to the trip. What can you say about the perfect weather that adds to the fun!

Reviews.Title: “we will be back in 2012”
Reviews.Author: kevin p
Reviews.Content: Our golf group has taken a golf trip for 30 years, same 8 guys! We go in March every year. We chose RBI because we hadn't been to Ca and their was golf on the property. What a great spot, rooms were great and very comfortable, food and drink were excellent we had at least 4 meals there. The staff were great. I loved the Starbucks. The golf course was very well maintained and in excellent condition. You can't beat SD weather! We have been to HHI, Destin, Naples, Orlando, Scottsdale and Myrtle Beach. The vote for next year's destination was unanimous we are going back to the Rancho Bernardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: judith m
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for two nights but had a great time in Rancho Bernardo Inn. Highly recommended. Rooms are clean, staff is nice, restaurant is extremely good. !! It is a bit far from San Diego but it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely secluded hotel”
Reviews.Author: pataelliott
Reviews.Content: Another couple along with myself and my husband spent last weekend at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. We arrived to find a personal invitation from the manager to attend the Friday evening cocktail reception. We had delicious hors d'oeuvres along with premium wines and spirits by the pool. We spoke with several of the friendly staff who were catering to our need. This lovely inn is set amoung beautiful trees, lush landscape and a championship golf course. We got a terrific deal on the room rates through Skyauction.com. We were lucky as we found out that the hotel was totally sold out. All in all, it is a fabulous, warm, historic California hotel with 2011 amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa is Devine”
Reviews.Author: PITAup
Reviews.Content: The Spa at the Rancho Bernardo Inn is a wonderful place to visit. The have a salt water pool, a beautiful garden, a jacuzzi and much more. While waiting for our treatments we sat at the pool and enjoyed a gourmet lunch and adult beverages, which was served to us under the Cabanas. Heidi who did our treatments was absolutely the best.

Reviews.Title: “ummmm”
Reviews.Author: travelchickie25
Reviews.Content: the stay was ok, the staff was very friendly but we came across extra charges that we did not expect. the 20.00 resort fee did not include parking, and since we opted for valet, it was even more. we were supposed to get a golf "experience" with the extra add-on charge, but it was never discussed with us, and we never got details on how to redeem it. we had a living social voucher, which we had to prompt the front desk staff to give us all that we paid for, (kind of a pain). e.g. picnic basket, resort fee waived, etc. dinner was overpriced for cold food (we did the outdoor bbq buffet) and most of it was dried out and overcooked. brunch was very misleading, i was quoted a different price over the phone when we pre-booked reservations. it ended up being double what i was quoted. owch. 100 dollars for breakfast.. upon coming home i realized i had forgotten an article of clothing in my room. i called... 3 times? each time leaving a message for someone to call me back. on the 3rd day i got through to the department and they were able to assist me. which was great, i appreciated that. (squeaky wheel gets the grease). and now, a few days after i get home I noticed 2 different charges from the hotel on my credit card, both over 100.00 that i have been trying to rectify with their almost useless operators, and the subsequent voicemail i keep getting from their billing department. this is the 3rd day i have been trying to reach S. Petersen, but she never seems to be at her desk, or she doesn't feel the need to return voicemail messages. what was supposed to be a nice staycation has turned into one headache after another. very disappointing and i'm upset that they even have my credit card information at this point, who knows what they're charging.. :/

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing stay for the price that you will NEVER find anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: cshiller
Reviews.Content: I didn't see the Rancho Bernardo inn before I reserved my stay. And did I ever get a pleasant surprise. My wife and I literally felt like royalty our entire stay. There is no reason for you to leave during your entire stay. To be honest I'm not sure you will want to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property ,”
Reviews.Author: LesClos
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD STAFF , HAD GROUP FUNCTION, FOOD seemed to be .one notch down each night. but it still was not bad .the place is solid.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: BaileyCR
Reviews.Content: tips for this property: Hotel is 60's style low slung small buildings built on the golf course. The rooms are remodeled and well appointed. Lots included w/rate and resort fee of abt $20. Internet/valet etc. One really cool thing is they stock the fridge w/soda and beer and snacks and it's included. very nice. Told them I was there for anniversary and they left in my room while I was at dinner: two glass bottles of Evian, fruit and a bottle of champagne. Classy. Friendly servers/bellhops/front desk. Rooms overlooking golf course are better, have better bathrooms and beds but I've had both and been satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Spa VERY OVERPRICED for the poor service I received:(”
Reviews.Author: First_trip_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights. Thought I would relax at the Spa but VERY over priced. I was more stressed when I came out because of the POOR service I received. I need my money back. VERY disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T use their Spa. WASTE of your money.”
Reviews.Author: First_trip_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. Was looking forward to their spa service. Turned to be TOTAL waste of my money. I could have received better service for 1/3 rd of the money I paid them plus it would have lasted longer. Horrible! Wish I could get a full refund. But other than that it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly0013
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to the spa for the day. It was incredible. The saline pool was the perfect temperature, the cabanas were relaxing with full service food and bar. Ask for Heidi Dial for facials and waxes. She was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Came back so relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: KendraHoward
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely wonderful, the staff was very friendly and went out of their way for us several times during our stay. The only thing that was a little less than pleasant was the food at the Veranda. Both my husband and I ordered the steak and it was not the best quality. Other than that our stay was very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jjbaca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are really picky when it comes to hotels and service. We booked this hotel and wasn't sure because most of the reviews are good but some are not. I can tell you that this hotel is so nice. We got a 3rd floor room with a king bed. I think the 3rd floor rooms are the rooms with really cool vaulted ceilings. Balcony overlooked a "garden view" with a few fountains below and it was a great location. Room was very clean and updated. Did not look worn or old at all. The room was also huge. Much larger than the standard hotel room. Service from every staff member that we came in contact with was first class. Guests need to pay extra to use the Spa pool, but they have 2 other pools that looked great. You do need to drive down a residential street to get there but its only about a 1/2 mile drive, better than being right off the freeway. My wife and I came here this time but i would not hesitate to bring our children next time. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sustained Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Shuguh
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the RB Inn was the 20th -24th of July. I have stayed there many times since 2003. This place embodies classic Southern California decor with exquisitely designed grounds and a remarkably consistent high level of service. I look forward to my trips to this area in large part due to the quality of this property. There are two pools on the property, one for adults and one for family, but I highly recommend the pool at the spa for an exquisite experience. If you get a chance to get a massage by Corey or a facial by Heidi I strongly suggest you take that opportunity. Both of these people offer world-class treatments with an easy-going, yet professional manner. There are a number of separate buildings of guest rooms within the complex, each with different qualities, but the rooms are generally all well-appointed with super comfortable beds. The one downside I have noticed is the breakfast on the Terrace overlooking the golf course has gotten less imaginative and more streamlined. I have not eaten in the other restaurants in a few years. The combination of a great, well-maintained property staffed with people who are sincerely interested helping the guests makes for an unforgettable and sublime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, hope the company holds our meeting there again! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hildamae
Reviews.Content: The room was beautifully furnished with gorgeous and inviting bed linens/pillows. It was all very comfortable and love the "stage bed" with the ambiant lighting. My patio was always perfectly clean with the groundskeepers sweeping the pathways/patios every morning. The catering department did a wonderful job with both food and service. I don't know the cost because our company was meeting there for a week long sales kick-off. However, I know our corporation is budget conscious. The food was delicious, creative and at temperature when served. The staff was friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Teri2000
Reviews.Content: This outing was a gift from my daughter for Mother's Day. She used the Social Living Website and purchased the Wine Tour package. The three wineries were excellent and the tour was enjoyed by both my husband and myself. Service was excellent. I would recommend this inn without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We stay everytime we are in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia6900
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to this Inn for a couple of years now. We've stayed many times and never want to leave! Whether with family, kids, or just a couples thing, the Rancho Bernardo Inn is the place to stay in San Diego! The resort is so beautiful, not to mention the great golf course! Rooms are always clean. The restaurants on site are awesome and they have some of the best food we've ever tried. Great place for weddings too. Last but not least the staff are always absolutely wonderful, we always feel completely taken care of when we stay. Would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE ANYWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: NOKIDS
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed anywhere that provided the customer service that the Rancho Bernardo Inn provided. Also, we never encountered better customer service at ANY establishment...ever (restaurants, stores, etc.). The staff ALWAYS went above/beyond the call of duty. There was never a 'bad vibe' received from anyone associated with the hotel, no matter the request. The attitudes of all staff members was always upbeat and never once did we feel like we were being an imposition. We will be informing all friends and family of what a wonderful stay we experienced at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. Thanx!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back with more friends!!!”
Reviews.Author: 32655Luv2travel
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful and very family friendly. Very clean and very friendly. I felt very comfortable letting my boys explore the resort on their own. If you have children who love the pool ask for a poolside room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis in Rancho Bernardo!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRotarian
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo is a master planned community about 15 miles east of the coast in San Diego county. The Rancho Bernardo Inn is a lushly landscaped Spanish style resort with spa and golf course in the heart of the community and just a few minutes from Interstate 15. We live nearby and go there frequently to play the course or go to the beautiful spa but until this week, we never stayed there. Our room was comfortable and fresh and had a wonderful balcony overlooking the golf course. We enjoyed lunch and dinner at the outdoor restaurant, The Veranda. The service was impeccable and we were always met with a smile. The spa and spa pool are newer and beautiful. We did not use any spa services so did not have access to those facilities. The hotel pool and spa are a bit dated but have the "old California" feel. All in all, a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: jeffd64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect. A great location with spacious rooms that are clean and comfortable. The staff was very courteous and the grounds were immaculate. A great golf course with fun pools for the family.

Reviews.Title: “A magical retreat in San Diego - excellent spa and restaurants, relaxing setting”
Reviews.Author: layla72
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this property. Overall, Rancho Bernardo is beautiful, elegant, serene, magical. It is a large resort in San Diego, about 30 minutes drive from the downtown area. It is also a country club/golf club, so there are some "regulars" who hang out by the bar in early evenings. Lovely decor and interior design, lots of nooks to relax, talk, have a drink, or read a book. There are two full-service restaurants on site, a golf course, a full spa, and several pools. I was very impressed by how well all the staff were trained - every single staff member was friendly, greeted us, and went out of their way to assist us. Truly exceptional service. The grounds are extensive and very well maintained. We took walks around the grounds before and after meals and were amazed at how beautiful and well kept the property is, and how diverse the plants and trees were. Restaurants were excellent, although it was a little confusing to figure out where the restaurants are located and what they served. Menus weren't readily available in our rooms, online, or at the door. The spa services, staff, and building are very high end. I had an outdoor massage and a facial, and both were wonderful. The massage was the best I've had and I overhead other guests in awe over the quality of the massage as well. I strongly recommend the outdoor massage followed by a quiet lunch and cocktails at the spa-only pool. Hotel rooms are split into several buildings and you are provided a map upon check-in. It is a little confusing at first, but the property is manageable on foot. Note that resort fees and parking fees may or may not be included in your rate, so be sure to check on that if you are on a budget. We saw several families there as a group and one pool is designated for families and all others are adults only. They had some kid-only activities like an outdoor kid movie at the pool, so they do have some family-friendly activities. However, I'd recommend this property most for a romantic getaway for couples and for a girls' weekend complete with spa treatments.

Reviews.Title: “Losing their personal touch”
Reviews.Author: MBrooks76
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights for a conference. Multiple problems, mis-led (being nice - was worse) by front desk, medicore service, and spotty cell coverage in the hotel (ATT's problem, not theirs, but who can live without cell service?). Perhaps they are getting too big - losing their personal touch. Front desk granted a late check out - so we re-arranged flights, etc to stay at hotel more, but that AM - was told (by the person who told me we had been granted a late check out) that we had to be out by 11AM. Front desk lady told me things had changed - but did not tell us. Breakfast service qutie slow - so go for the buffet unless you have 45-60 mins for breakfast - which most of us do not.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: happyinthedesert
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best place we've been to in a long time. The staff and service was fantastic !! The servers called you by your name. Every staff memeber we came upon was alwasy offering to help in any way. The grounds were just beautiful. Water falls everywere. We do not Golf, but the Golf course was beautiful. Beautiful fireplace and fire pit in the outside lounge area, very cozy and enjoyable. We will be back. The Stadlmayr's

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place tucked away”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: The golf resort is quite large and spread out and the resort grounds are very pretty, although the resort is incongruously located in the middle of a residential neighborhood. I was here for a conference (it seems to be a popular venue for business meetings), so did not get to enjoy the hotel facilities much unfortunately. A pity as the spa looked very inviting. There is a decent gym which overlooks the scenic golf course. The business conference facilities were superb, with a very nice outdoor garden area perfect for cocktails in the evening. The resort rooms were quaint, comfortable, although I had problems sleeping as the pillows just did not agree with me. Housekeeping was a little sloppy as well. This is probably a great place for middle-aged couples and families who want a weekend away. The resort is located about 30 mins from San Diego central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sumfn41
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights to relax and enjoy a different part of San Diego. The resort is definitely big and quiet. The rooms were very nice and spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We enjoyed sleeping in because it was always quiet and we definitely enjoyed sitting outside our balcony every morning. However, My husband and I (mid/late 20s) felt out of place because everyone staying here was definitely over 50+. It does definitely cater to an older wealthier crowd. We still enjoyed our stay but would probably not stay here because of the age difference.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: sdanette
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and need paint. Left an item in the room and called right away to pick it up. Could get no service from any department, not even the manager regarding the matter.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: greenapple28
Reviews.Content: OK so we pulled up to this hotel and all we saw were..... 40+ yr old men playing golf. my friend and I (both 21) came for vacation and weren't feeling it. we were so wrong! i would not have wanted it any other way. yes, it was far (30 mins) away from Downtown and all the 'happening' areas,but that was fine. the resort has such a big property we found so much to do on it and meet new ppl (when we did bump into anyone younger than 40 we would get so excited and both us and them would get all excited like "omg! someone under 40!") we had a good laugh but as the weekend went on, younger ppl came there. (for weddings etc). theyre rly friendly here, and its super relaxing with adult pools (no kids) family pool and then a special pool just for those who are at the spa. oh, and a HUGE golf course. overall, my experience was wonderful - if youre looking to party every night in DT , this might not be the place for you (we went there once - cab ONE way is about 80$... ) if youre here to relax and maybe drop down to DT one during your visit, this place is perfect. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: NeedTimeOut
Reviews.Content: We have been to RBI in the past and it has been the most relaxing place. I slept 14 hours every day for three days. A perfect get away and you will feel relaxed the minute you step on the property. It starts with the smell of the wood burning when you register. The packages are great.... golf, dining, spa. We took advantage of all of them and got the best value for our money. Golf, massage, pedicure and more golf. The course was in good shape. The wait staff is the best and the food amazing. We have never had a bad stay at RBI and will be back.... soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “We always look forward to our stay at the RB Inn!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceecee28
Reviews.Content: What we love about this inn is the feeling that you are among friends--you can visit here once a year and find the same great staff--enthusiastic and smiling---to greet you. The hotel is lovely, and the grounds are stunning. There are 3 pools---all salt water--one is in the spa. The spa is just incredibly beautiful. This is a great place to relax away from the hubub of the obvious tourist areas, yet you can be downtown or at the beach in less than 25 minutes! And because this is located where it is, you will have sunny days and very little marine layer clouds! The breakfasts, lunches and dinners are great, but it is the people that work there that make it so special. I Love it....and so will you!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking location with above average service”
Reviews.Author: WinsorTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is tucked away in the foothills about 15 miles north of San Diego proper- far enough away to feel like you are on vacation. The layout is very well done, making it feel as if you are staying in a much more intimate property. Food and beverage service was above average, and the staff seem very happy and committed. The grounds could use a little more upkeep and my room in particular was quite dated- but the view and landscaping were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL FRIENDLY STAFF EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!”
Reviews.Author: CALILOVEPS
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as part of a deal on Living Social. We decided to do the wine tours to the 3 wineries in the area. Our room was amazing and we had a great view. The only problem we had was getting a bit lost on the grounds trying to find which building we were staying in but that's a minor thing. Other than that our stay was amazing!! We went to the pool and there was a band playing as part of a convention that was being held there. So we got some entertainment while relaxing. We ate at the Veranda restaurant, which is a bit pricy, but VERY well worth it!! We sat outside and enjoyed the sunset and spectacular views of the mountains. I would consider getting married here because I loved it!! Thank you for making our stay a spectacular experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaG_72
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beautifully kept grounds. Very clean, pretty and contemporary hotel room. Staff very helpful and nice. I wish I had more time to enjoy the amenities that the hotel offered.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous jewel in the big city!”
Reviews.Author: Meanjeans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at Rancho Bernardo Inn for my birthday and had a fabulous time! We're from San Diego, but just needed a little getaway, and it really felt like we were FAR away. From the moment we arrived, the staff was incredibly friendly and gracious, our room was really nicely done, and there were a lot of little bonuses that made the stay memorable. For example, I don't know if this was done by the staff or a previous guest in our room, but the mini-fridge had sodas, snacks, beer and bottled water. Not a typical mini-bar situation, just there for the taking. The waiter at the Veranda restaurant (steak- A+) used our names when waiting on us, and we overall just felt really welcome. The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous! It was so nice to walk around and enjoy the peace and quiet of this beautiful hotel. My only complaint is that the doors don't have deadbolts, and seem a bit thin, as we could hear people talking in the hallway from inside our room. However, at night it was perfectly quiet, and we slept like logs. This would be the perfect place for another quick getaway and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax for The Over 40 Crowd or Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: NickT1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Memorial day holiday and it was my first time visting. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and from the minute you walk in, the service is excellent. You get the feeling that the staff is willing to go the extra mile to satisfy you and on a few occassions, and they did. As far as the rooms, they are very clean and our room had a balcony which overlooked a courtyard and you could hear the noise of multiple fountains. Unfortunately, there are some things that the hotel needs to work on. First and foremost, the place definitely needs a remodel. The hallways, rooms, and the bathrooms need a facelift. The bathrooms especially are very dark and depressing. The adult pool definitely needs to be redone as most of the pool tiles had cracked and stuff was starting to grow out of them. Furthermore, the hotel is located about 30 minutes from downtown San Diego. I say this because we spent most of our time in Downtown since we are in our early 30's and the hotel was just too boring to hang out. As an example, we wanted to get some starbucks from the coffee shop at around 7 PM and it was already closed. You get the feeling that everything shuts down at 6 PM...LOL Overall, if you are 40+ or traveling with kids, this place is perfect, younger crowds, I recommend looking somewhere in Downtown San Diego where you are closer to the daytime activities, .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - Beautiful Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: Tdbb819
Reviews.Content: We came with a group of 30 to golf. The entire staff from valet/bell to golf were exceptional and couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. I wish we had stayed longer than the weekend because I really would have loved to visit the spa. The rooms were lovely and I could NOT hear my neighbors. I definately will visit this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing yet Rejuvenating - Energetic yet Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan1064
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn... it was the 2nd time staying there for me.... and hopefully there will be many more times. From the moment of arrival (where we were greeted by a lovely Receptionist named Hannah) until departure, every aspect of our stay was very relaxing yet rejuvenating. We leisurely roamed the property and everywhere we turned we met smiling employees' faces. The grounds were immaculate and the overall atmosphere was energetic yet peaceful. I would highly recommend this beautiful property to anyone (and as a District Travel Manager for AAA I've stayed at quite-a-few very nice resorts over the years).

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: DocLarge
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three days on a recent visit to San Diego. It is indeed a remote setting nestled among a lovely suburban area about 15-20 minutes from the downtown area. Still, you are only a few minutes away from the interstate entrance and shopping/dining options. The overall setting is that of an exclusive country club, with immaculate landscaping, a family and adult pool (heated), outside jacuzzi and nice little water features scattered around. If you are like me and like to take a leisurely stroll around the grounds, this is the perfect place to do so. You might even run into a fruit tree! Our room was on the ground level, with a veranda to sit outside and sip a beverage. Our room featured a 42 inch plasma tv with plenty of channels to watch. Bathroom was a decent size with a tub/shower combo and two sink areas. My only complaint was that I couldn't avoid stepping on the drain while taking a shower, causing the tub to fill with water. I didn't use the restaurants but I did enjoy the coffee shop. They served Starbucks coffee and had a nice assortment of pastries. Cozy little nooks to sit down and relax with a paper. There were also internet stations for you to use. An absolute pleasure for any coffee affectionado. Overall, this was a first class resort all the way around. The staff were all helpful and friendly as could be, and were more than willinging to make me a satisfied customer. I don't play golf, so I can't comment on that aspect, but if you are looking for a peaceful getaway from the busy life, this is the place to do so. I'm so glad I stayed here and not some cookie-cutter type chain hotel. I am much richer for the experience. Its all about the little touches that make you feel like a papmpered guest. Great job RBI staff!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, elegant and wonderful spa facilities”
Reviews.Author: JoanneBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and had the best time. We checked in early and enjoyed the outdoor spa facilities. They also have a great spa pool and the spa staff are so friendly and courteous. We then went to dinner at the high end Italian restaurant on site, the service and food was impeccable. After a great dinner we went to our room with our own private garden and relaxed. The next morning we were back at the spa enjoying the amenities again. I highly recomend this place if you are ever visiting the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, enjoy golf, spa, food and service”
Reviews.Author: RoelandP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo for a couple of times during our US West coast trip, in the beginning and the end to be more precise. Both stays fullfilled and even overtopped our expectations by far. The Inn's location is unique, calm and ideal for some relaxation. The Spa treatment is the best we have had during our trip and incomparable to those we get here at home in Europe :) . I liked the attention of the waiters, their punctuality and ofcourse the food was the greatest. On sunday we came back to enjoy sunday lunch or brunch as it was called. It was like 7 courses or something, very nice and extensive and above all delicious. the pianoman was playing great songs too :D

Reviews.Title: “Local San Diego Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sadie2005sandiego
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a spa day and dinner with friends. The grounds along make you feel refreshed. The spa treatment and the staff were great. Holly at the front desk made me feel so welcome and helped me find my way around the property. Dinner at El Bizcocho was amazing. James, the sommenlier was so personable and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, sunday brunch is the best.”
Reviews.Author: heleenvanlier
Reviews.Content: Went on a round trip USA and a friend recommended it. That friend earned some serious kudos, it was really great. This place is beautiful and the service is great. As an European, the American service is ten times better anyway, but even compared to the avarage American service this was great. The sunday brunch in the Veranda restaurant - I think it was called that way, but not sure anymore - was the best brunch I ever had, I wished I had 7 stomachs.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ShannaMW
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay through LivingSocial and the overall experience surpassed my expectations. The hotel was beautiful, with plenty of room to walk around and the staff were all very friendly and eager to find out how to make my experience the best possible. You absolutely get your money's worth here!

Reviews.Title: “This property is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: HollySipHed
Reviews.Content: We went on business, my spouse and I, and we loved every moment. It's an old property tucked in a residential area outside San Diego. We asked for a very quiet room and got just that. The spa is world renowned and stood up to its reputation, if you are interested in a lovely peaceful place with lots of fountains, beautiful gardens and charm, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to have a conference”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Rancho Bernard Inn with colleagues and clients at a corporate event, and found it relaxing and charming. I was given a large room with a small, hedged in seating area outside a picture window. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well. The bathroom was large and everything worked, and it had two sinks so one guest could shower as the other got themselves ready. The conference facilities were great and are surrounding by lovely well tended grounds. We were able to spend time enjoying the grounds and getting some sun because the conference center was surrounded by lovely landscaping and accessible walking paths. The only problem I had was finding electric outlets to charge my phones and computer. They were there, but hidden, and I eventually used the outlets in the bathroom rather than unplug the lights.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant, Relaxing, and Productive Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jkayew
Reviews.Content: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is a wonderful facility to host a conference or a business meeting. The event and hotel managers, as well as the staff, are pleasant to work with and very accommodating and reasonable. The attendees often commented about how they were enjoying their time there and the conference setup, with many options for outdoor registration and meals. It proved to be a very beautiful, relaxed, and smooth event! Food variety was also outstanding and quite delicious! The commute from the airport is not too difficult and is only 35 minutes or less.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the nice lobby fool you, everything else is straight down hill.”
Reviews.Author: VonHarper
Reviews.Content: I had a work conference at this "Inn" so I wasn't even paying and I still feel like I have been had! The rooms are old, the buildings a loud so you hear ever foot step above you and neighbors toilet flush. There are zero amenities...no cotton balls, lotion etc. For the morning coffee there was sweet in low...is this the 1970's? it is just not luxury at all. In my room my tv couldn't even be watched from the bed not to mention I was basically in the dungeon with zero light and view. Then the service...just awful. There was one person at the front checking people and she was slow. I tell her I am a light sleeper and ask for a quiet room so she puts me on the bottom floor...does that make sense? The room number was 718 so it seemed like a higher floor. Then in the morning the room service took 45 minutes and instead of a large pot of coffee which I ordered, they bring me one cold cup? Don't be swayed by the pictures of the lobby and the " spa and golf".... Save your money and stay anywhere else. A colleague is staying at the Hilton Garden Inn about a mile away and I can guarantee you he had a better night's sleep, better service at a margin of the cost. I have been here one night and I cannot wait to be waving goodbye to this place!

Reviews.Title: “RBI exceeded all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Thor6316
Reviews.Content: The RBI Resort was excellent. It exceeded all of our expectations. The golf course was immaculate and the rooms, food, and service were excellent. Bob Dubek, the golf course superintendent, was extremely helpful and accommodating. My friends and I hope to spend other "golf" vacations at this superb resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: wmasstraveler11
Reviews.Content: So friendly and accommodating - beautiful grounds and room. Fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: markyt20
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on a Friday afternoon, and although we had to fight a lot of traffic to get there from the airport we were pleasantly surprised when we finally arrived. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and we were checked in very quickly. We were escorted to our room, and upon arriving the young man carrying our bags even offered to retieve ice for us. We ate dinner at the Restaurant there and it was very good and fairly reasonable. The location was not the greatest for what we wanted to do, but would be great for those looking for an intimate and exclusive hotel with a great golf facility on site. We would have to drive about 30-45 minutes to the gas lamp district and about 20 minutes to pacific beach. I was there on business and was impressed by the facilities overall. The resort is vast, and the conferance facilities are top notch and very comfortable. Overall we were very happy with our stay, and I would recommand this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time”
Reviews.Author: LVPecks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for a weekend. Wife used the spa and said it was excellent. Inn was located very close to the San Diego Safari Park only took 15 minutes to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but could use some upgrades - 80s bathrooms...”
Reviews.Author: VIAJONOW
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort but could use some upgrades, especially the bathrooms. The food was great at Bizcocho restaurante. The casual restaurant was OK but not great. Gardens and pool areas are beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Northern San Diego County Amazes a Local!”
Reviews.Author: skinnedknee
Reviews.Content: My mother won an overnight stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn (an "All Play No Pay" package) at a silent auction for a charity. She lives in Rancho Bernardo, and I had been driving to see her for 20 years ~ and yet I had never even seen the Rancho Bernardo Inn....and THAT'S one of the great things about it. Unassuming and tucked away in the rolling hills of northern San Diego county, it is a perfect getaway for locals as well as those looking to avoid the beach crowds of tourists that flock to the typical San Diego destinations. The grounds are immaculate (as it's a golf resort) and the building are tiered around the property, with mature trees, lots of shade, outside patios with fireplaces and other outside areas. We stayed in a "Deluxe Resort Double Queen" and the room was big, quiet and had lots of amenities. The bathroom was huge! There was a jacuzzi tub, separate shower, separate toilet area and 2 separate vanity areas so that everyone has space to get ready for dinner (or to go out for the day) at the same time. There were 2 queen beds with "memory foam" tops and an assortment of 4 different pillows on each bed for sleeping comfort. Internet was included in our package (check to make sure it's included in your package) at no charge. Huge flat screen tv with the usual choices, coffee maker and refrigerator and 2 closets, and a full length mirror were all wonderful to have. The room was really clean, bright and airy, especially with the balcony doors open. Carpet and linens were in great shape, as were the spa robes in the room. We had 50 minute massages included in the package. The massages were done in small outside rooms with heated tables in a quiet outdoor setting. If you don't get the package, their Signature massage is $120 for 50 minutes. Since it was my first massage, I can't tell you whether or not it was "good", but I can tell you that the waiting room was relaxing and filled with complimentary fruit, teas, flavored water and spa music. There were 2 hot tubs (one a women only and indoors, one outdoors) and a steam room available with your spa purchase. The outdoor pool and hot tub are salt water and heated to 82 degrees year round. I'm not a golfer, but the people going by with bags all seemed to be smiling, so it can't be all that bad! We ate at "The Veranda" for early dinner. The menu wasn't extensive, but it wasn't expensive either, with my margerita pizza being $10.....the food was good, service was absolutely great and the view was beautiful. They have a Sunday Brunch that packs the house on Sundays, so make sure you make reservations if that's your meal of choice. Overall I was very impressed. For the money, it is a great deal. I'm not a spa girl, and I wouldn't hesitate to tell friends to stay at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. It's seclusion and peacefulness (well, besides the golf cart!) mixed with it's cleanliness and great service make you feel pampered and spoiled. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fees, parking fees, give me a break”
Reviews.Author: sbtraveler1095
Reviews.Content: Nice updated room, facilities are aging. Cable tv not working because of the rain, 2 packages of DE-CAF coffee, no regular, could hear the phone conversation in the next room. Pricey hotel to start then add resort fees for things I didn't use, and parking fees. In the end not a good value, better places to stay for less in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Place where Service comes first”
Reviews.Author: BayouPlaquemine
Reviews.Content: Every employee I came in contact with was friendly and courteous. I was always asked if there was anything that I needed. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The bedding was adequate but nothing spectacular. The golf course was exceptional! I played Torrey Pines North Course on Saturday and except for the views there was no difference in quality. I was a little put off by the $10 per day parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, comfty bed and relaxing layout”
Reviews.Author: capps
Reviews.Content: If you like golf, this is the place. Nice pool variety and ground well manicured. Not near the beach as located in a neighborhood, but friendly staff and layout is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shimmy17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights visiting some extended Family members before Christmas. The place is well decorated at Christmas time with the beautiful smell of cedar emanating throughout the resort. At this time each night they have gingerbread house making, which is great for the kids and my younger cousins enthusiastically took advantage of this option. The rooms look updated with flat screens and double vanities. A couple of complaints are that first I found the pillows to be a little too soft, however, that is just a personal preference. The other is that during the entire stay in San Diego there was a torrential downpour and the open layout of the resort required us to have to use an umbrella and walk across the resort to access the valet, not alway enjoyable each time you want to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: TOB3
Reviews.Content: Particularly enjoyed the outdoor veranda with fire pits. Room was spacious and comfortable. My wife loved the bathroom! Staff are unbelievable!! We were called by name almost everywhere we went on the property.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: allisonv
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo is an excellent hotel. Myself ,mom and daughter enjoyed this stay tremendously. The hotel is beautiful and there is a serene and peaceful feeling thru out the hotel. I must say the staff is exceptional in their customer service and their attention to detail for the most relaxing and enjoyable time. If you want to really have a relaxing time,please take time to enjoy the spa, its wonderful and the staff especially arlene is excellent. A great place for dining was the Veranda, Mr. James Cassady made sure our request and needs were met even though it was a hectic Saturday Night. The Sunday Brunch is also wonderful with excellent food. It definetly was a home away from home only difference is we felt very pampered with all the wonderful help and attention from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous tranquility and the best spa!”
Reviews.Author: vtgals
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my daughter for a spa treat. Property is exceptionally clean, beautiful grounds and a very secluded feel. Location is tucked away from the busy feel of the city life yet is convenient to everything. We had the best spa treatments we've ever had ( and we have had our fair share) and highly recommend the spa. Fabulous! The room was spacious and very clean. We received an unsolicited room upgrade which was very welcomed. Sheets are the only issue, a little on the thin and rough side but very adequate. This property is delightful and I would suggest it to anyone looking for value in a peaceful, clean and friendly property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience for Spa and Golf package resort”
Reviews.Author: doncm42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for a short three-day stay. After reading prior reviews, I had three concerns: noise, extra charges added to the bill. I spent extra time with the Reservations Agent talking about room options. We selected a suite that opened onto the golf course. It was everything the website claimed; great view, excellent decor and very comfortable. It was also quiet. When you buy a package (Spa, Golf or meal included), the charge gets posted to your bill and the desk staff take it back off. At checkout, both Golf and Spa were still on my bill but the Desk agent caught it before she handed me the bill. Everything else was correct. We thought the food was mearly ok but pretty expensive so not a good value. Steer clear of the breakfast buffet if you want your eggs fresh. Compared to the chain hotels I stay at, the buffet was pretty limited. On the flip side though, the restaraunt staff is extremely attentive and professional. My wife completely enjoyed the Spa experience. The staff were friendly, professional and skilled. The facility was clean and inviting. She came away relaxed and invigorated. The golf course is fun and has some good challenging holes. It rained hard one of the days of our stay but the next morning the course was in great shape. Hat's off to the grounds staff. The shop staff, cart setup, starters and marshals all worked to make for a good round. They keep play at a good pace so a round should finish in 4 1/2 hous. Ours did. I can't figure out the parking fee - $10/night. There's plenty said about it so no surprises for me - and it is still irksome. We enjoyed this hotel, the grounds, the staff and the golf/spa. We'll eat away from the hotel and there are plenty of choices close by. We'll come again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, well appointed rooms....but....”
Reviews.Author: Tdn
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved the grounds of this Inn with it's fountains and gardens, various comfortable, well placed seating areas throughout the property! Gorgeous gorgeous landscaping! We booked 2 nights with a travel special and wondered if we were relegated to a less appealing room with our package. The details were not disclosed r.e. if breakfast was included one or both days and how our winery tasting and transportation would be provided. When we arrived at front desk they weren't sure either. We asked a couple times ahead about the shuttle to the nearby winery included in our "pkg., they said it went every hr. on the hr. - no reservations needed. Next day when we were in the lobby at 9:55 to try to make the 10 am shuttle, the Bell man said we needed a reservation. We went to ask again at the front desk, they said he must be too busy to take us right now, so we went on our ow Beautiful room decor! Our main complaint was the vent in the bathroom didn't work. Also, the shower/bath fixtures were backward and shower head so high that you could get burned before you got it adjusted. The walls were very thin, we could hear parts of entire conversations of a family next to us (and they weren't partying, just normal conversation...but late and early hours). I have a habit in all our travels of utilizing the ventilation system for "white noise", but it was very noisy... every time the fan kicked in it would wake you up at night. Upon entering room noticed coffee cups were dirty and napkins used...front desk replaced with a phone call to the front desk. We then found that the coffee maker was broken when we tried to make coffee the first morning, front desk replaced for us prompty with a call. We recieved a coffee maker that functioned properly for our second morning, but we were left only Decaf coffee packets by our housekeeper...very disorganized for a "posh" resort/inn!! I wouldn't want to pay full price at this Inn unless I was sure there would not be these issues.. It is such a beautiful, relaxing atmosphere..you feel like you are going to be pampered in all ways upon arrival. We did feel pampered by the wonderful surroundings, but not with some amenities missing, or not taken care of. I don't know if clients who pay full price have these same issues, I would hope not. We would love to visit this property again if these issues were addressed by Mr Gates and the management of the Rancho Bernard Inn.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a relaxing getaway and want to feel pampered, this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: katerobinson24
Reviews.Content: A true hidden gem. We wanted to relax between Christmas and New Year and this was such a pleasant surprise. First time we had been despite living in LA for over 2 decades. Would highly recommend. Great room, one of best overall spa expreinces we have had, wonderful cuisine, but best of all was hotel service. Despite being very busy, every member of staff without exception made you feel special and welcomed you as special guest. Fantastic overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GoGirl75093
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our second visit to the Rancho Bernardo Inn as a getaway after Christmas. We love the California atmosphere, gorgeous grounds, friendly staff and excellent food. While we were there we both had massages and the facility and quality of the services were excellent. This is a very relaxing and family-friendly place also. So much to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “No THANKS_giving”
Reviews.Author: two2keikis
Reviews.Content: I write this letter to tripadvisor users to save you from staying somewhere where your dollar isnt worth the stay. My family and i have stayed here three times and during theses times nothing seems to change. The grounds are kept clean you can find cans, water bottles etc in plant areas which isnt a great to see. The rooms look fine when you check in, but you have problems with plumbing and air conditioning. On one of our visits the room had the loudest air condition i've ever heard in my hotel stay and it would come on and off. On our last visit which was thanksgiving weekend we were extremely disappointed and have decided we are not going to have visit again. First of all we checked in to two rooms ; one for us and one for my mil (mother in law). When we arrived her room had water by the sliding door and our bathroom was experiencing some plumbing issues because the sinks were making sounds etc. The next day mil room was imense in water (bathroom and hall area); we were told they had some sort water issue upstairs, but didnt mention that on the first day! they were blaming the water sprinklers. Our dinner was also horrible the turkey was dry, the dessert was probably out of a box. Do yourself a favor stay somewhere else like the lowes might be out of the way, but we havent had a problem there.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Christmas tradition”
Reviews.Author: roachma
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the "stay and play package". We golfed on Christmas day and it was wonderful. I highly recommend the Sunday brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to spend a romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: adventurelori9
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were traveling to San Diego to see the Chargers game and I decided to give Rancho Bernardo Inn a try after seeing a great deal on travelzoo. The deal included a room, free breakfast and free wine tasting at the local winery. The whole experience was amazing! We got free car service to and from the winery and 10 free tastings. Then I upgraded the room to a Premiere King and it was beautiful, clean and had plenty of open space and a patio over looking the golf course. We signed up for a couples massage and although it was a little pricey, it was one of the best I've ever had. We then had dinner at the Veranda where the service was excellent. Actually the service was excellent no matter what we did there. I truly felt pampered. It was a romantic, fun experience that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing in Southern California”
Reviews.Author: eve1941
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time ...the Christmas trees &decorations were tremendous.Played cards by one of the fireplaces after dinner.The staff was excellent.Enjoyed our beautiful room and a wonderful breakfast.Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend Get-Away at the Rancho Bernardo Inn”
Reviews.Author: LJCD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn this past weekend to celebrate our 1 year Wedding Anniversary. What a perfect place to celebrate! The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas and created a magical warm atmosphere. Everywhere you look there were beautiful Christmas Trees, Holiday decorations, and warm fireplaces to cozy up to. Our experience began with an overly expceptional greeting by the front desk woman named Leslie. She was extremely personable, friendly and professional. She booked us reservations for dinner at the Veranda and offered us a number of hotel services. She made my husband and I feel very welcome and congratulated us on 1 year of happy marriage. Our room was very clean and comforatable, dinner was excellent, and brunch the next day was phenominal. Due to the cool weather we were limited to the extended hotel accomidations that the RB Inn offers, but we felt as though we were staying in a high end Aspin Lodge! Our Anniversary was one we will never forget and we will continue to visit the Rancho Bernardo Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in our stay--Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tmitchmv
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the RB Inn while visiting family in Poway for Thanksgiving. My husband and I were looking forward to a relaxing weekend while the kids stayed at grandma's house. Unfortunately we were sorely disappointed and left feeling ripped off. We checked in and headed to our room. When we opened the door I stepped into the room to turn on the lights only to find my shoe and the bottom of my pants completely soaked from a pool of water that had run from the bathroom into the entry way of the room due to a leaking toilet. We headed to the front desk to change rooms where they told us that they only had a room with 2 queen beds left...we had reserved a king. Eventually they found one for us, but it clearly wasn't ready for guests. When we arrived we were short towels, the toilet paper was almost gone and there was no replacement roll, there was no bathmat when we got out of the shower, there was no kleenex, no trash can, there was a dead rat outside the room with crows stopping by for a snack, ants in the bathroom and the cleanliness of the bathroom counter left something to be desired. These problems persisted even after housekeeping visited the following morning. They recently remodeled the hotel. The rooms have some nice built in cabinetry now, but the walls and floors were very dirty and needed some attention. When they replaced the carpet the didn't bother to take off the baseboards, so the carpet stopped about 1/4 inch from the wall/ basebaords and was all shredded and coming up on the edges. It was also stained and dirty. We went to the fitness center to workout and the short comings continued. There were no towels or clean headsets to use. We had booked a friends and family rate that was advertised in a mailer we had received. One of the ammenities was that the in room mini bar was included in our rate. It would have been a great deal if the bar had ever been stocked. Finally, when we went to check out, they had added a $40 restauarant charge for a meal that was not ours to our bill. By the time all was said and done, (charging for self parking in surface lots that are empty, passing along San Diego Marketing fees to the traveler, resort fees for things services that we don't use) our two night stay cost us about $400. We left feeling very ripped off and disappointed in the quality of our stay. We have stayed at many Perferred Resorts and are usually happy with the hotel. This was a disappointment. When we shared our experience with the front desk we were told "thanks for your feedback." Not quite the service I would expect. The grounds are beautiful and they could make this a great resort, it's too bad it has fallen short of it's potential.

Reviews.Title: “The Halloween Event is Worthy!”
Reviews.Author: TrabFamily
Reviews.Content: We are locals and recently stayed at the Inn for the Halloween Event. Our 8 year old son loved it! It was fun and relaxing for Mom and Dad too. After the festivities, we enjoyed a leisurely dinner buffet on the Veranda. The weather was perfect, as was our room and all of the amenities. We'll definitely come back for more local mini vacations. Joy took our reservation and also assisted with a change of plans before we arrived. She was polite, gracious and provided the best customer service I've received in a long time. Thanks RB Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Get get away”
Reviews.Author: LovesLauderdale
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and quiet, I was a get away for me as we were there on business and also pleasure so I had plenty of time to relax and enjoy myself as it was my husband who was there for work. the staff was friendly and helpful. The grounds of the hotel were well kept and there were times that i felt I had the whole hotel to myself. There are may places to curl up and read a book or sit out by the pool or a slip into a hot tub. The valet staff were young and fresh a plus to and older yet great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and Excellent Facilities and Service”
Reviews.Author: Corning6000
Reviews.Content: As frequent guests at The Rancho Bernardo Inn, have found the facilities and service to be consistently excellent. Beautiful surroundings, thoughtful, capable, and friendly staff , and high quality facilities provide a particularly warm environment. Restaurants are impressive, as well. We believe that The Rancho Bernardo Inn to be one of the best options in the greater San Diego area and can highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Full Service Resort! Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: brandmac
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing weekend! Not just for the adults but for the kids too! This hotel offered hands down the best service we have ever experienced at a resort. The amenties are top of the line, including Aveda bath products and down comforters. Wood burning fireplaces all about the property. Fine dining, casual family dining. A ful sports bar to watch a Sunday game. Everything on property. We never had to leave! We can't say enough about the staff, they went above and beyond at every turn, every request. It's a wonderful romantic resort when you want to get away and spa or golf, it's also an amazing resort to take the family as they are always offering fun kid events on property for entire family to enjoy. The best of both worlds in one resort. We can't say enough, we will definetly be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with spa amenities AND fun for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: SummerDrake
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn at least 4 times now and each time it seems to get better and better. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms are wonderful and the kids have a great time with the "'S'more and Snore" tents in the rooms. The price is great, which usually includes breakfast, and is either buffet or off the menu, you get to choose! I can't say enough great things about it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous family trip”
Reviews.Author: Leanne921
Reviews.Content: Our family just stayed here over the weekend for their Halloween event. The kids had so much fun at the event that featured carnival games, face painting & more. The room was beautiful & our back door opened to a grassy area & fountain. The staff was very friendly & the food was great. We are definitely planning on staying here again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “The RB Inn is a beautiful, classic property which feels like old California”
Reviews.Author: lauradoris
Reviews.Content: A massage in a private casita is a must. Then lounge by the pool in a cabana and have appetizers and a glass of wine. Dinner at Veranda on the patio at sunset is wonderful. the staff is very welcoming. My family and I always enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: ramonamiki
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better time to celebrate my husband's birthday. We enjoyed the spa, gourmet restaurant and wonderful service at the Rancho Bernardo Inn. The staff went the extra mile to ensure our stay was exceptional. I am disabled and while the grounds are beautiful with rolling hills and wonderful plantings, the staff made it possible for me to get around with ease and comfort at my beck and call. Totally refreshed and ready to meet life's new challenges, we will return, hopefully often. Thank you so much for the best time

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business or personal”
Reviews.Author: lotsobiztravel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! We had our conference here.....between meetings it was relaxing and beautiful. Rooms and staff are great!! Have to try the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: traveler123Ohio
Reviews.Content: Rancho Bernardo experience was less than average at best. Rooms were tired looking and were in desperate need of an update especially in the bathroom / shower fixtures. The walls must be very thin as we could hear every conversation from the room next to us. There is a $15.00 resort fee that I did not agree with. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The golf course was not up to my expectations for a $75 greens fee. 3 greens were closed which was disapointment

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: newmrswilliams
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had an amazing Anniversary weekend here. The property is so quiet and beautiful. We would just walk around and get lost, it was great! The fireside lounge is awesome, make sure to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations”
Reviews.Author: suenjoel
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of our weekend at this resort was exceptional. The hotel itself is gorgeous - a word I overheard many times from other guests also! Although there were 4 rehearsal dinners and 3 weddings that weekend, they were barely noticeable - the grounds are laid out so there is no excessive noise, no crowding... The staff - the whole staff - were the most helpful and accommodating I've encountered. Dinner and breakfast at the Veranda were delicious and reasonable; brunch at El Bizcocho was over-the-top (although, one or two seafood dishes did not benefit from sitting around awhile.) The q/q room was comfortable and very roomy; plenty of space for 2 ladies to spread out without tripping over each other. The double-vanity in the bathroom is a nice touch, as is the small balcony with chairs. The only small problem was our room near the stairs, where it got a bit noisy during late-evening returns and early-morning check-outs. The spa atmosphere was relaxing and the treatments were as good as we expected them to be. Prices are high, but par for the course at a resort like this. Adult-only pool with cabanas was incredibly tranquil; spa lunch poolside was healthy and delicious. I booked thru Southwest Airlines Vacations, and expected a "value" experience, but on check-in, the manager threw in an invitation to the Manager's Reception and free breakfast at the Veranda, plus free items in the mini-fridge, like beer, wine, and snacks. Extra touches like this, and the free shuttle to other restaurants or shopping, made us feel like we were totally pampered all weekend. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandiegofamily1021
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year for our anniversary since this is where we got married. The hotel has only gotten better! The new day spa area is absolutely amazing. I went and had a facial and the room was so relaxing (as opposed to many stand alone spas). The spa had a resting area, steam room, showers, lockers (you get robes and slippers), etc. I also used the workout room before and this was really nice (big windows and not busy). My husband golfs while I am at the spa nd loves it! This hotel also has many pools so if you are buy yourself and go to the spa's pool but if you have children, there is a pool just for families with even pool toys. The staff is very professional and the whole feel about the resort is high class.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: garjan38
Reviews.Content: Excellent property. This is always my first choice when staying in this area. Every member of this hotel staff is professional and courteous. Front desk staff is very helpful. Enjoyed a wonderful dinner via room service. The service was prompt and food served hot. Christina in room service followed up with me to see if I enjoyed my meal. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. The grounds of this hotel are beautiful and well kept. Women traveling alone should feel very safe staying at this hotel. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic Get Away”
Reviews.Author: EvaAndJohn
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great place to get away and spark some romance. The Rancho Bernardo Inn was the perfect answer. It's only 20 minutes from downtown San Diego but the grounds suggested somewhere far from the crowds. We loved strolling the grounds and there were so many quiet places for us to just sit and talk, laugh and watch the abundant bird life that we couldn't try them all. The staff was excellent and the food was fabulous. Our room with a private patio was just what we were looking for. Wait! If I give them a good review everyone will want to come to our quiet little hide-away... It was awful! (Wink)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Spa, beautiful grounds and fluffy comfortable King.”
Reviews.Author: favazzd
Reviews.Content: Partner and I drove 8 hours to get there for a quick weekend wedding. Immediately we were comfortable in our room and had a great night's sleep in the big fluffy king bed. We chose the All play no pay spa day and it was fantastic. Professional, high quality spa and spa grounds. Full bar by the heated Saline pool and poolside lunch service. Perfect. There's a fabulous patio off the bar with outdoor fireplaces and comfy seating. Excellent get away weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Could be such a hit, had some misses”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: I worked with Joy to secure my rate, reservation and arrangements for our dog. Working with her was absolutely wonderful. She was very friendly and professional. The hotel itself has some wonderful qualities. The main building has an upscale lodge feel to it and is very beautiful. So are the grounds. The front desk staff needs some more training or a change in attitude. When you walk up to one of them, there is almost a look of fear in their eyes. It seems they are ready to be defensive. Smiles seem a little fake. The clerk who checked me in failed to tell me about the free breakfast and complimentary items in the mini-fridge. Fortunately, I was aware of them while making the reservation. The room was beautiful and overlooked the golf course. We were on the top level, so the ceilings were high. The room was very big, recently updated and well-furnished. The bathroom had double sinks which was nice. However, the bathrooms appeared a little older. There was a little mold in the shower, but not a deal-breaker. The restaurant was painfully slow, but forgivable our first morning. The second was an awful experience. To lure families, the resort offers kids free meals. When we went to breakfast, a few sets of parents, who were traveling together, were at the restaurant with their children. The kids were screaming and running all over the place. They also were only wearing bathing suits and no shoes which is actually a health code violation. The management did nothing and should have on its own. To make matters worse, our order was not taken for 20 minutes. Our pot of coffee was forgotten after three requests. The manager, noticing we were not happy, offered to credit our room for the cost of breakfast. We were satisfied with that, but after his offering, neither he nor anyone from the staff checked on us again. As we started to walk out, the manager ran over and apologized again. Also, self-park was $10 a day for guests. However, people who were at the hotel for functions were able to park in the same lot for free. And, in some cases, we could not find a parking space. At least it was at times we only had to quickly run to the room. We actually left our car in the fire zone with flashers! The resort has no way to really monitor who is parking where. You may want to just tell them you took a taxi to avoid the fee! Overall, if the price were more reasonable, I would consider staying at Rancho Bernardo Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Rancho Bernardo Inn Visit”
Reviews.Author: ninette_21
Reviews.Content: I found the accomodations and staff to be excellant. This was one of the most friendlist and beautiful resorts I have ever had the pleasure of staying at. I would highly recommend if you want to get away from it all and enjoy and beautiful surrounding and amazing food that you stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience from beginning to end.”
Reviews.Author: BlancaJ10
Reviews.Content: From the woman who took my reservation, to check-in, going to the spa & the restaurant- everyone was super pleasant and made sure all your wants and needs were met. I had stayed there last year when we celebrated my Mom's birthday. I was so impressed I decided to spend my birthday there and man did they make me feel special. The room was great as usual, clean & beautiful views not matter where you are located. It is so relaxing with the gardens, fountains and greenery all around. The spa is super nice- you have to try the saline pool. They have a bar in the pool area, I felt like I was at Club Med but better. The couples massage was amazing, did the outdoor cabana & I highly recommend. Had dinner at the Veranda, good food at affordable prices. Went back to room to find a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries & a nice personalized note thanking me for choosing the Inn to celebrate my special occasion. I felt so special!!! I can't wait to go back. My anniversary is in 2 months- hope they still have the All Play No Pay package. Also, spend some time exploring the grounds, it is just a lovely place & great decor.

Reviews.Title: “The Rancho Bernardo Inn gets customer service right!”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeRob
Reviews.Content: It was so refreshing to find a resort that gets customer service right. From the time we pulled up to the curb until the time we checked out the customer service was superb! The food was excellent especially The Veranda, make sure you ask for Jimmy! I would highly reccomend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great destination resort!!”
Reviews.Author: jenry3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn several times over the past 4-5 years, and we're always treated like lifelong friends by the staff. You can't walk across the beautiful grounds without someone smiling and greeting you warmly. The rooms are a good value for the price, and the remodeled Veranda restaurant is awesome! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Little disappointments everywhere”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict0077
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights as part of a wedding block reservation. While the grounds are beautiful and the Inn was conveniently located for the wedding events, we were disappointed enough with several small things that we would not recommend the Inn to friends. First, as another reviewer mentioned, the air conditioning in the room is very loud (especially when you are in the sink area outside the bathroom). Second, the iron in our room was so crusted with hard water deposits and gunk that it left residue on a shirt. We had to call the front desk twice and stop by once over the course of a day to get a new one (and it still had deposits, though not as bad). Third, the sound insulation between rooms (especially those with doors that allow for adjoining rooms) is poor. We were in a room next to a family with young children, and the sound traveled right through the (closed) adjoining doors. Crying babies are a part of life, but hopefully not part of your hotel stay. Fourth, the room was not made up when we returned at 3pm to get ready for the wedding after a day of sightseeing. The housekeeper stopped by shortly afterward, but we had to tell her to come back since we were busy showering and changing. Fifth, we heard from other wedding guests that one of the other buildings at the Inn was completely without water for most of a day. We were lucky to have avoided that, but now I can guess that's why maintenance men were dealing with a walkway near the family pool that was flooded with stinky overflow water. Yuck. Sixth, the bridal party had arranged for golf cart service to shuttle the guests between the Inn and the wedding site (at a private home half a mile down the residential road leading to the Inn). When we asked both the valet and the front desk about the service, however, they didn't know anything about it, and we ended up driving to the wedding (we had to arrive a bit early to the wedding to help, but I was surprised that no one had even heard of these arrangements). I'm not sure if this was a miscommunication by the hotel or the bridal party, but it was certainly a frustration. Finally, I think it is ridiculous that the hotel charges $10 a day for self-parking in an open lot. This is an Inn in a residential area 30 minutes from downtown San Diego where all guests are likely to have a car. Charge for valet, sure, but charging for VERY tiny self-parking spots is a ripoff (and was not mentioned to me when I made a reservation, unlike the $20/day resort fee, which was mentioned repeatedly). I doubt that they charge people who merely come as guests at the restaurants or for events at the Inn, so they certainly shouldn't charge hotel guests. Again, all of these would count as small disappointments and these things may not have bothered me at a downscale hotel, but when you are paying as much as the RB Inn charges (even at the discounted block rate) I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting planners - take note - the Rancho Bernardo Inn is ideal for business meetings!”
Reviews.Author: healthysusan
Reviews.Content: I managed an event for my company at the Rancho Bernardo Inn that was attended by 200 people. The entire staff went out of their way to make the week go smoothly. The staff truly felt like an extension of our own people. Literally, from the top down, this property is totally customer focused. Our event requires very specific banquet menus and the culinary team totally exceeded our expectations. The quality of the food and the presentation of the food was outstanding. The property is beautifully maintained with lovely spots to relax and enjoy the grounds. The spa facility is one of the finest I have experienced. You can not go wrong at the Rancho Bernardo Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay here again for the money”
Reviews.Author: ceeteetrpt
Reviews.Content: Front desk not very friendly - I negotiated a no resort fee but couldnt get rid of the lame $10 parking fee in an uncovered lot by the way. Check out was un friendly as well - bill was in-correct first time and I got attitude when I circled the charges that needed to come off. Kids Rule package attractive - all meals for kids free. Premium room was good - the hotel needs newer plush toels - the pool towels were better than the room towels. I wasn't treated by the hotel staff as well as I would have like for the $269 a night - before taxes and all. Veranda restaurant is good - good view - almost all waiters were good except for one. BEWARE - The pool on Rancho Bernardo Inn's website is the SPA pool with cabana's - no kids allowed - the family pool is nothing special at all....plus there was next to nobody staying at the hotel - I think I was being lied to over the reservation phone when I was haggling over room prices - wasn't a WOW experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury is not always better.”
Reviews.Author: Anotherknight
Reviews.Content: Be well aware that this hotel will charge an additional $22.50 a day for (Resort Fees)and $10 parking fees. This is charged even if you never use any service of the hotel. The hotel had a negative vibe at the front desk. Every dealing with them, they referenced that this was a Priceline reservation. I have never had this experience before. Maybe I have become chain hotel oriented, Always the same and knowing what to expect. Over all condition of the hotel is ok. There is no wow factor here. Air conditon is very loud in room.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KNX65
Reviews.Content: I just love this place. Set north of San Diego, near Escondido and Rancho Sante Fe, off Highway 15. Quite, serene and really a residential location. Older hotel with wonderful renovated quality. Spanish California style. Great Golf, tennis and many other facilities. Beautiful, up to date rooms in casually elegant style. Excellent accommodating staff. Very good dining, with wonderful terrace lunches and great brunch. You could sink in here and never leave. Standard resort fees, fair rates for what is offered. A place one could spend several days enjoying the ambience, facilities and food. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation...the entire family had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: toddnicole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RB Inn for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The kids loved all of the activities, including a tent in our room and a movie at the pool. My husband enjoyed playing golf at a beautiful course and I was in heaven getting a massage in their fantastic spa. I highly recommend this hotel to families with or without kids. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodated all of our wishes. Our room overlooked the golf course on the first level so the kids could run around and blow bubbles on the grass while my husband and I enjoyed happy hour on our patio. If you are looking for a vacation spot to make everyone in the family happy look no further than the RB Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, priced higher than value, veranda restaurant good, no service follow through”
Reviews.Author: Grandma39
